subject: Uniquely identify builds to prevent race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 18:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/docker_build.bash'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/40894614ac2d54c38eb4cdeaf724c4798c66a70d', 'message': 'Uniquely identify builds to prevent race

In the original implementation of this, the latest running container
containing "PICKME" was selected for the container to export. This
creates a race condition.

Change-Id: Iaaf5683435f424517774067a1d95732ad096c988
'}]
commit_message:
Uniquely identify builds to prevent race

In the original implementation of this, the latest running container
containing "PICKME" was selected for the container to export. This
creates a race condition.

Instead we now identify the image by a UUID created each run, so that
they will not overlap if multiple builds happen simultaneously.

Change-Id: Iaaf5683435f424517774067a1d95732ad096c988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/83/88383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create a UUID to identify the build CONTAINER_UUID=`uuidgen` docker run oemdocker echo $CONTAINER_UUID CONTAINER=`docker ps -a --no-trunc |grep $CONTAINER_UUID|awk '{print $1}'|head -n1`
deleted_lines: docker run oemdocker echo PICKME CONTAINER=`docker ps -a |grep PICKME|awk '{print $1}'|head -n1`

commit_message:
gw_port should be set as lazy='join'

This forces the object to be ready ahead of accessing time.
The change in loading behavior is also beneficial while listing
routers, as reduces the amount of queries being issued. Tests
show a performance gain of 15-30% for router-list times.

As Mr. Aaron Rosen is used to saying: Woot woot!!

Closes-bug: #1309144

Change-Id: Ibae261b91de26ca7c50e3f6c80e9be2a799785a3
(cherry picked from commit 966dbb5368d710e2652b18f5b9cb4295f58598da)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/69/88669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gw_port = orm.relationship(models_v2.Port, lazy='joined')

commit_message:
ENV['RELEASES'] overrides the [cuttlefish dumpling emperor]

The RELEASES environment variable contains the list of ceph releases for
which integration tests are going to be run. This is convenient to speed
up tests when debugging the logic of the implementation and before
making sure it works accross all distributions.

Change-Id: I0d0a6af6f07aeba72c42e6f853353ccf97db8658
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/10/89210/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: releases = ENV['RELEASES'] ? ENV['RELEASES'].split : [ 'cuttlefish', 'dumpling', 'emperor' ]

commit_message:
Move files common for mysql and mariadb under mysql-common

Because galera library path has to be set in mysql config file,
we create a symlink during install time to make sure that there is
always same path for mysql and mariadb and for all architectures.

Change-Id: Iea3264932ec621d3d7618c5c50cbe47a956fb332

subject: Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 22:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9bfc5b0bf58ecb7de5904cbd41db6de7330187e3', 'message': "Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node

There was a bug in the code that checked to see if the
appropriate WWPN for a preferred node was available on the storage
host in intialize_connection.  It was assumed that there would only
ever be one preferred WWPN.  The code just checked to see if the list of
preferred WWPNs was in the list of available WWPNs.  This would only work
if all of the WWPNs were available on the storage host.  This resulted in
volumes not being able to be mounted when they should have been
available.

This fix changes the check of the preferred WWPNs to check each
item in the list until one is found.  The first one found is used
as the target WWPN.  If no match is found, the old default behavior
of selecting the first available WWPN is used.  I have added a
warning message for this case as it is quite possible that this
won't work in the user's environment as was the case that uncovered
this bug.

Note that this change is only relevant for systems that are not using
multipath as systems that use multipath don't choose one WWPN, they
just send the whole available list back.

Change-Id: I8d3239da24a8f9fbd8309ba5c90b05b29a068754
Close-bug: 1308298
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node

There was a bug in the code that checked to see if the
appropriate WWPN for a preferred node was available on the storage
host in intialize_connection.  It was assumed that there would only
ever be one preferred WWPN.  The code just checked to see if the list of
preferred WWPNs was in the list of available WWPNs.  This would only work
if all of the WWPNs were available on the storage host.  This resulted in
volumes not being able to be mounted when they should have been
available.

This fix changes the check of the preferred WWPNs to check each
item in the list until one is found.  The first one found is used
as the target WWPN.  If no match is found, the old default behavior
of selecting the first available WWPN is used.  I have added a
warning message for this case as it is quite possible that this
won't work in the user's environment as was the case that uncovered
this bug.

Note that this change is only relevant for systems that are not using
multipath as systems that use multipath don't choose one WWPN, they
just send the whole available list back.

Change-Id: I8d3239da24a8f9fbd8309ba5c90b05b29a068754
Close-bug: 1308298
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/05/88705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_storwize_initiator_multiple_preferred_nodes_matching(self): # Set the context. ctxt = context.get_admin_context() # Generate us a test volume volume = self._generate_vol_info(None, None) self.driver.create_volume(volume) # Fibre Channel volume type vol_type = volume_types.create(ctxt, 'FC', {'protocol': 'FC'}) volume['volume_type_id'] = vol_type['id'] # Make sure that the volumes have been created self._assert_vol_exists(volume['name'], True) #Set up one WWPN that won't match and one that will. self.driver._state['storage_nodes']['1']['WWPN'] = ['123456789ABCDEF0', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0010'] wwpns = ['ff00000000000000', 'ff00000000000001'] connector = {'host': 'storwize-svc-test', 'wwpns': wwpns} with mock.patch.object(helpers.StorwizeHelpers, 'get_conn_fc_wwpns') as get_mappings: get_mappings.return_value = ['AABBCCDDEEFF0001', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0002', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0010', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0012'] # Initialize the connection init_ret = self.driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) # Make sure we use the preferred WWPN. self.assertEqual(init_ret['data']['target_wwn'], 'AABBCCDDEEFF0010') def test_storwize_initiator_multiple_preferred_nodes_no_matching(self): # Set the context. ctxt = context.get_admin_context() # Generate us a test volume volume = self._generate_vol_info(None, None) self.driver.create_volume(volume) # Fibre Channel volume type vol_type = volume_types.create(ctxt, 'FC', {'protocol': 'FC'}) volume['volume_type_id'] = vol_type['id'] # Make sure that the volumes have been created self._assert_vol_exists(volume['name'], True) #Set up WWPNs that will not match what is available. self.driver._state['storage_nodes']['1']['WWPN'] = ['123456789ABCDEF0', '123456789ABCDEF1'] wwpns = ['ff00000000000000', 'ff00000000000001'] connector = {'host': 'storwize-svc-test', 'wwpns': wwpns} with mock.patch.object(helpers.StorwizeHelpers, 'get_conn_fc_wwpns') as get_mappings: get_mappings.return_value = ['AABBCCDDEEFF0001', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0002', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0010', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0012'] # Initialize the connection init_ret = self.driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) # Make sure we use the first available WWPN. self.assertEqual(init_ret['data']['target_wwn'], 'AABBCCDDEEFF0001') def test_storwize_initiator_single_preferred_node_matching(self): # Set the context ctxt = context.get_admin_context() # Generate us a test volume volume = self._generate_vol_info(None, None) self.driver.create_volume(volume) # Fibre Channel volume type vol_type = volume_types.create(ctxt, 'FC', {'protocol': 'FC'}) volume['volume_type_id'] = vol_type['id'] # Make sure that the volumes have been created self._assert_vol_exists(volume['name'], True) #Set up one WWPN. self.driver._state['storage_nodes']['1']['WWPN'] = ['AABBCCDDEEFF0012'] wwpns = ['ff00000000000000', 'ff00000000000001'] connector = {'host': 'storwize-svc-test', 'wwpns': wwpns} with mock.patch.object(helpers.StorwizeHelpers, 'get_conn_fc_wwpns') as get_mappings: get_mappings.return_value = ['AABBCCDDEEFF0001', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0002', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0010', 'AABBCCDDEEFF0012'] # Initialize the connection init_ret = self.driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) # Make sure we use the preferred WWPN. self.assertEqual(init_ret['data']['target_wwn'], 'AABBCCDDEEFF0012')

subject: Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-24 20:46:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9777b7661e9c452857db0e21ca8b2eecb17cef7c', 'message': 'WIP: Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer previously supported a configuration consisting of three network interfaces.  One interface was for management, one was for high availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the VIP and PIP are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the PIP and the high availability backup.

During VIP creation, this code change detects if the incoming configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If so it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to obtain an IP address for the PIP and saves that port ID as a vDirect workflow persistent parameter.  vDirect is then directed to create an load balancer with the PIP interface as the HA network instead of using the container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, this code change detects if a qport for the PIP had been previously allocated by querying the vDirect workflow persistent parameters.  If so, it deletes that qport.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-28 16:56:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0535530c5e23d520f407f687a0138cd30b291252', 'message': 'WIP: Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the VIP
and PIP are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network as the HA network instead of using the vDirect
container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-04 15:20:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/26b8d008e8719ad5d69b23998f19af9c3d58421f', 'message': 'Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the VIP
and PIP are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network also used as the HA network instead of using the
vDirect container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-12 15:37:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bde3364abada06155b1cc3086bee1d663dc3bb3d', 'message': 'Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the VIP
and PIP are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network also used as the HA network instead of using the
vDirect container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

commit_message:
Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the
IP that the outside world sees (VIP) and the IP that the servers
respond to (PIP) are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network also used as the HA network instead of using the
vDirect container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728

commit_message:
Deprecate instance_get_all_by_filters() from conductor

This deprecates the instance_get_all_by_filters() method from
conductor, which is no longer used.

This also removes a test that was mocking the conductor method,
but that really tests nothing at all. Perhaps a new test to ensure
that the period=0 case is handled properly is in order, but this
test definitely wasn't doing that.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I1e7bc19296d1773bbc2f5f9e77a1faf0e6ac1fe6

commit_message:
Make a bigger column for storing task results in mysql

This patch adds new 2 types called BigText that actually use LongText
instead of Text in case of mysql

And use this new type for colum with task results

Change-Id: I6878e07f9d22257f45aa3d92fcfe9f15f1eef897
Closes-bug: #1300181

commit_message:
Added mounting and umounting /target

It turned out that in some cases it is necessary to umount
all mount points which are connected to a particular disk
before creating other partitions on that disk.

Change-Id: I43a2de132415d026a6dc096e2b25ce0ab4cce915
Closes-Bug: #1297792
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/80/89980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _umount_target(self): self.late("umount /target/dev") self.late("umount /target/sys") self.late("umount /target/proc") self.late("umount /target/boot") self.late("umount /target") self.late("swapoff {0}{1}4".format(self.os_disk, self._pseparator(self.os_disk))) def _mount_target(self): self.late("mount {0}{1}3 /target".format(self.os_disk, self._pseparator(self.os_disk))) self.late("mount {0}{1}2 /target/boot".format(self.os_disk, self._pseparator(self.os_disk))) self.late("mount -t proc none /target/proc") self.late("mount -o bind /dev /target/dev") self.late("mount -o bind /sys /target/sys") self.late("swapon {0}{1}4".format(self.os_disk, self._pseparator(self.os_disk))) self._umount_target() self._mount_target() self._umount_target() self._mount_target() for disk in self.iterdisks(): for part in filter(lambda p: p["type"] == "partition" and p["mount"] != "/boot" and p["size"] > 0 and p.get('name') != 'cephjournal', disk["volumes"]): self._umount_target() self._mount_target() self._umount_target() self._mount_target()
deleted_lines: self.late("umount /target/proc") self.late("mount -o bind /proc /target/proc") self.late("umount /target/sys") self.late("mount -o bind /sys /target/sys")

commit_message:
Fix redundant add operation of set in ring

You don't need to add dev_id into seen_ids again when it has already existed in seen_ids.

Fixes Bug #1311190

Change-Id: If0766de8dc5e2a59a648cae39c789c91131805d2

commit_message:
Add link to a resource's nested stack

When viewing a resource, it's valuable to know whether the resource is a
nested stack with additional resources attached to it.  This change
provides a new 'nested' link in the links section of a resource, which
points to the nested stack.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint nested-stack-link
Change-Id: Ibc8768d2be8f1dae9a60d3818ae9f56c27bbdc9b

commit_message:
wip: this needs to be made in oslo

This does not need to be reviewed because it will be replace with a path
to update gettextutils in oslo once a patch is completed and accepted.

I will mark this as WIP, but I tend to forget that it gets taken our of
WIP every time it's pushed to Gerrit.

Change-Id: Icf95beb41bd30fb47e1ead07d39f91a1ba38762a

commit_message:
Code change for nova support cinder client v2

Use v2 volume endpoint to attach/detach volume would be failed,
due to nova not supporting cinder client v2 yet. This patch is for
nova support cinder client v2.

Implements bp support-cinderclient-v2
Closes-Bug: #1215772

Change-Id: I0ebbba4b7fd58b0e6e5ee54f50d368527c2f4dff

commit_message:
Update swift's selinux policies

Allow swift permission to /mnt/state/var/cache/swift.
Allow rsync to write to /mnt/state/var/log/rsyncd.log.

Move directory creation from post-configure.d to configure.d.

Change-Id: I9c8730be8d880229ec3224690f46406d55b2e8e1

commit_message:
Add PyECLib as a requirement

Swift will call into PyECLib for erasure coding functions.
This is in preparation for the change in review:
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/66482

PyECLib is BSD licensed.

Change-Id: I0884256fa9e65101ff7673a32eea0ecea0ad257b
Signed-off-by: Tushar Gohad <tushar.gohad@intel.com>

commit_message:
Rewrite rabbit init scripts

This scripts are takes from packages and retry loops
are added. When booted nodes will wait for the primary
node goes up and then will connect to the cluster.

Closes-bug: 1308455
Change-Id: I6748577e71c0e2be10a9298b9691c335e5be45c5

subject: Don't stream by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-16 11:16:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/a63a85c2f96211d463cf5c2e75da73e913edae92', 'message': "Don't stream by default

Current `_Iterator` streams data from the server by default. This
behavior, although useful, shouldn't be considered a sane default. A
good example is when using `limit` on listing operations. If the default
is to stream, the limit will be ignored because the server client will
get everything from the server until there's anything left to consume.
This behavior can also be harmful if not used carefully.

This patch adds a `stream` method to the iterator and makes using this
behavior an explicit operation. The user has to opt-in for data
streaming.

Change-Id: Ib1af24960dff97cb956990d4caf88705f2f7a0d5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-16 15:39:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/478c7035ab9ba8c07684d6b471296c880df9ca5c', 'message': "Don't stream by default

commit_message:
Don't stream by default

Current `_Iterator` streams data from the server by default. This
behavior, although useful, shouldn't be considered a sane default. A
good example is when using `limit` on listing operations. If the default
is to stream, the limit will be ignored because the server client will
get everything from the server until there's anything left to consume.
This behavior can also be harmful if not used carefully.

This patch adds a `stream` method to the iterator and makes using this
behavior an explicit operation. The user has to opt-in for data
streaming.

Change-Id: Ib1af24960dff97cb956990d4caf88705f2f7a0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/34/87934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._stream = False def stream(self, enabled=True): """ Make this `_Iterator` a stream iterator. Since `_Iterator`'s default is to *not* stream, this method's default value is to *stream* data from the server. That is, unless explicitly specified this method will enable make this iterator a stream iterator. :param enabled: Whether streaming should be enabled or not. :type enabled: bool """ self._stream = enabled return self if not self._stream: raise StopIteration

Separate tags with commas on Application Details page

makes the tags comma separated.

commit_message:
Use jsonschema for testing queue

Validate response of listing queues (GET /queue) with jsonschema in
functional tests. Also the signature of assertSchema was changed:
now it accepts not the schema itself, but its name. It was done to
simplify its usage in test cases.

Partially implements: blueprint jsonschema-validation

Change-Id: Ic48236607746eae088300ff7a6f787622a2156f7

commit_message:
fix OSTF init workflow for docker deployment

Now on docker-build production phase the
OSTF initialization script will not run.
Only after starting the container in
docker production mode will the init run.
Legacy 'prod' deployment mode is not
affected.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: I1a2ac06d7de34ee8777e647ab7dbd4419bb0c7c5

The previous code was failing to display the members of server
groups because it was filtering them all out.

Interestingly, the previous code passes the unit tests due to a
bug where we treat regex comparisons differently when using mysql
vs sqlite (tracked under bug 1298690).

Change-Id: I7be9c180f4284dd18cd02e510e77e3c1e3fc9925

commit_message:
Fix display of server group members

The previous code was failing to display the members of server
groups because it was filtering them all out.

Interestingly, the previous code passes the unit tests due to a
bug where we treat regex comparisons differently when using mysql
vs sqlite (tracked under bug 1298690).

Change-Id: I7be9c180f4284dd18cd02e510e77e3c1e3fc9925
Closes-bug: 1298494
(cherry picked from commit 8ce30b6ac7ea8d2e036a621a9904b35cb1563672)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/89657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/45/87345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LE can be used to suppress the exception. For example:: except Exception: with save_and_reraise_exception() as ctxt: decide_if_need_reraise() if not should_be_reraised: ctxt.reraise = False If another exception occurs and reraise flag is False, the saved exception will not be logged. If the caller wants to raise new exception during exception handling he/she sets reraise to False initially with an ability to set it back to True if needed:: except Exception: with save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as ctxt: [if statements to determine whether to raise a new exception] # Not raising a new exception, so reraise ctxt.reraise = True def __init__(self, reraise=True): self.reraise = reraise if self.reraise: logging.error(_LE('Original exception being dropped: %s'), traceback.format_exception(self.type_, self.value, self.tb)) _LE('Unexpected exception occurred %d time(s)... ' 'retrying.') % exc_count)
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa can be used to suppress the exception. For example: except Exception: with save_and_reraise_exception() as ctxt: decide_if_need_reraise() if not should_be_reraised: ctxt.reraise = False def __init__(self): self.reraise = True logging.error(_('Original exception being dropped: %s'), traceback.format_exception(self.type_, self.value, self.tb)) _('Unexpected exception occurred %d time(s)... ' 'retrying.') % exc_count)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/90084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Private IP addresses are used for communication between instances, and public ones are used for communication with networks outside the cloud, including the Internet.</para> <para>A pool of floating IP addresses, configured by the cloud operator, is available in OpenStack Compute. You can allocate a certain number of these IP addresses to a project. The maximum number of floating IP addresses per project is defined by the quota.</para> <para>After you allocate floating IP addresses to a project, you can add a floating IP address from this set to an instance of the project. You can assign a floating IP address to one instance at a time. Floating IP addresses can be disassociated from an instance and associated with another instance of the same project at any time.</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>To list all floating IP addresses, run the following command:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-bulk-list</userinput> <computeroutput>+------------+---------------+---------------+--------+-----------+ </listitem> <listitem> <para>To list all pools that provide floating IP addresses, run the following command:</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> <para>You can assign floating IP addresses to a project and to an <para>Run the following command to allocate a floating IP address to the current project. If more than one IP address pool is available, you can specify the pool from which to allocate the IP address. This example specifies the <literal>public</literal> pool:</para> <para>After at least one floating IP address is allocated to the project, assign an IP address to an instance in the project, as follows:</para> <para>To remove a floating IP address from an instance, specify the same arguments that you used to assign the IP address, but run the following command:</para> <step> <para>To release a floating IP address from the current project, run the following command:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-delete <replaceable>FLOATING_IP</replaceable></userinput></screen> <para>The IP address is returned to the pool of IP addresses that are available for all projects. If an IP address is assigned to a running instance, it is disassociated from the instance.</para> </step>
deleted_lines: <para>Private IP addresses are used for communication between instances, and public ones are used for communication with the outside world.</para> <para>A pool of floating IPs, configured by the cloud operator, is available in OpenStack Compute.</para> <para>You can allocate a certain number of these to a project: The maximum number of floating IP addresses per project is defined by the quota.</para> <para>You can add a floating IP address from this set to an instance of the project. Floating IP addresses can be dynamically disassociated and associated with other instances of the same project at any time.</para> <para>Before you can assign a floating IP address to an instance, you first must allocate floating IPs to a project. After floating IP addresses have been allocated to the current project, you can assign them to running instances.</para> <para>You can assign a floating IP address to one instance at a time.</para> <procedure> <step> <para>To list all floating IP addresses:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-bulk-list</userinput></screen> <screen><computeroutput>+------------+---------------+---------------+--------+-----------+ </step> <step> <para>To list all pools that provide floating IP addresses:</para> </step> </procedure> <para>You can assign floating IP addresses to a project or an <para>Allocate a floating IP address to the current project. If more than one IP address pool is available, you can specify the pool from which to allocate the IP address. This example specifies the <literal>public</literal> pool:</para> <para>To release a floating IP address from the current project:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-delete <replaceable>FLOATING_IP</replaceable></userinput></screen> <para>The IP address is returned to the pool of IP addresses that are available for all projects. If an IP address is assigned to a running instance, it is disassociated from the instance.</para> </step> <step> <para>To associate an IP address with an instance, at least one floating IP address must be allocated to the current project.</para> <para>To assign a floating IP address to an instance:</para> <para>To remove a floating IP address from an instance, specify the same arguments that you used to assign the IP address:</para>

commit_message:
Adding port-forwards for openstack-identity

The identity-bind.host value needs to be set to 0.0.0.0 so it will bind
to all ports. The port-forwards from vagrant attach to eth0, however the
catalog entries still need to be 127.0.0.1.

Change-Id: I37dc12956f26c682ccb066a016d25fd827273827
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo refs/changes/91/89991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "endpoints": { "identity-bind": { "host": "0.0.0.0" } },

commit_message:
Add cinder-lio element

Adds install steps needed for using cinder-lio and makes it
possible to configure the iscsi_helper option in cinder.conf

Change-Id: Ie741845b669621dd5cd481e9de22caea62312af2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/63/78463/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Use lio as the cinder iscsi helper. Requires that the Heat template parameter CinderISCSIHelper be set to "lioadm".

commit_message:
Fix incorrect usage of sa.String() type

In downgrade of 4eca4a84f08a_remove_ml2_cisco_cred_db migartion
there is a mistake in usage SQLAlchemy String type.
Used sa.string() instead of sa.String()

Change-Id: I521dd63ca2b48e902ca2cb17c45a3fe996b060e7
Closes-bug: #1312124

commit_message:
Set admin user tenant to 'admin'

This change allows the admin user to automatically be associated
with the 'admin' tenant upon logging into horizon

The maximum number of floating IP addresses per project is defined by the quota.</para> <para>After you allocate floating IP addresses to a project, you can add a floating IP address from this set to an instance of the project. You can assign a floating IP address to one instance at a time. Floating IP addresses can be disassociated from an instance and associated with another instance of the same project at any time.</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>To list all floating IP addresses, run the following command:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-bulk-list</userinput> <computeroutput>+------------+---------------+---------------+--------+-----------+ </listitem> <listitem> <para>To list all pools that provide floating IP addresses, run the following command:</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> <para>You can assign floating IP addresses to a project and to an <para>Run the following command to allocate a floating IP address to the current project. If more than one IP address pool is available, you can specify the pool from which to allocate the IP address. This example specifies the <literal>public</literal> pool:</para> <para>After at least one floating IP address is allocated to the project, assign an IP address to an instance in the project, as follows:</para> <para>To remove a floating IP address from an instance, specify the same arguments that you used to assign the IP address, but run the following command:</para> <step> <para>To release a floating IP address from the current project, run the following command:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova floating-ip-delete <replaceable>FLOATING_IP</replaceable></userinput></screen> <para>The IP address is returned to the pool of IP addresses that are available for all projects. If an IP address is assigned to a running instance, it is disassociated from the instance.</para> </step>

commit_message:
Fix exercises running on rally-scenario-job

Exercises would not run if environment variable DEVSTACK_GATE_EXERCISES
is not set to 1

Change-Id: Ic0e28d831683373d5191f24d2c40ba6e8b6fc668
Related: blueprint rally-gate-jobs
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/53/86253/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_GATE_EXERCISES=1

commit_message:
Refactoring of mongodb host selector

* Moving ugly puppet logic into a function.
* Making simple mode work same as HA mode
  with primary and slave nodes

Change-Id: Ic5a334364afcd3673d1353db3685025e9da40b97
Closes-bug: 1308988

subject: Support custom PyPI mirrors for setup-clienttools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 10:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-clienttools'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/6fa37681cd9b47fe18cb0ae1a157fe0a698c2489', 'message': 'Support custom PyPI mirrors for setup-clienttools

If custom PyPI mirrors are configured for the pypi DIB element
use them for pip installs in setup-clienttools also (it seems
unlikely a user would want to use mirrors for one part of their
devtest run and not another).

Change-Id: If94c1376f86a461df17e45ddd71dec67a083093f
'}]
commit_message:
Support custom PyPI mirrors for setup-clienttools

If custom PyPI mirrors are configured for the pypi DIB element
use them for pip installs in setup-clienttools also (it seems
unlikely a user would want to use mirrors for one part of their
devtest run and not another).

Change-Id: If94c1376f86a461df17e45ddd71dec67a083093f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/49/90049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If custom PyPI mirrors are configured for the pypi DIB element # use them here also. MIRROR_URLS=$(compgen -A variable | grep PYPI_MIRROR_URL) for MIRROR_URL in ${MIRROR_URLS} do echo ${MIRROR_URL}=${!MIRROR_URL} PIP_OPTIONS="${PIP_OPTIONS:-""} --index-url=${!MIRROR_URL}" done pip install ${PIP_OPTIONS} -U 'setuptools>=1.0'pip install ${PIP_OPTIONS} -U 'pbr>=0.5.21,<1.0' pip install ${PIP_OPTIONS} -U python-cinderclient python-novaclient python-glanceclient python-heatclient python-keystoneclient python-neutronclient python-swiftclient python-ironicclient python-openstackclient os-apply-config
deleted_lines: pip install -U 'setuptools>=1.0'pip install -U 'pbr>=0.5.21,<1.0' pip install -U python-cinderclient python-novaclient python-glanceclient python-heatclient python-keystoneclient python-neutronclient python-swiftclient python-ironicclient python-openstackclient os-apply-config

Added scheduler_driver_task_period info to scheduler section.

Added default value and brief intro.

Closes-bug: #1285377

added_lines: <para>Compute is configured with the following default scheduler options in the <filename>/etc/nova/nova.conf</filename> file:</para>scheduler_driver_task_period=60 <para>By default, the scheduler_driver is configured as a filter scheduler, as described in the next section. In the default configuration, this scheduler considers hosts that meet all the following criteria:</para> <para>The scheduler caches its list of available hosts; you can determine how often the list is updated by modifying the <option>scheduler_driver_task_period</option> value.</para> <note><para>Do not configure <option>service_down_time</option> to be much smaller than <option>scheduler_driver_task_period</option>; otherwise, hosts will appear to be dead while the host list is being cached.</para></note>

commit_message:
Remove py3kcompat module

Remove use of py3kcompat module, which has been removed from oslo-incubator.
Replace it with six, which is already in the dependencies.

Update common apiclient from Oslo for that. I've updated
to oslo-incubator of commit 04a1abe59ac39890f57d2eed57d3d1b12bb5d757

List of recent changes:

04a1abe Revert "Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class"
86707cd Remove None for dict.get()
6650435 Fix usage of dict.keys in apiclient.exceptions
35dc1d7 py3kcompat: remove

Change-Id: Iab72688ea3ae7ff4c9c707b7939e1a12ff1a72b2

commit_message:
Fix adding linked applications to an Environment

They were broken due to the addition of WofkflowManagementForm at the
wizard's last step.

Also remove unused PostgreSQLField from dynamic_ui.

Change-Id: I44b53ef4edc9fda4723531f75aa2e0c4831908fa

commit_message:
Murano HA mode

Fix Murano HA mode:
* oslo.messaging used for murano-api and for 'system' RabbitMQ
* rabbit_hosts / rabbit_ha_queues are used
* haproxy added

Change-Id: I524179f76bc45525c4b9d4de75b655b5f8c52eed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/20/89820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Murano uses two RabbitMQ - one from OpenStack and another one installed on each controller # The second instance is used different port, that's why we can't use 'amqp_hosts', which # contains RabbitMQ port numbers, and shoud use 'amqp_nodes' list instead. # 'murano_rabbit_nodes' will be converted to 'murano_rabbit_hosts' internally. murano_rabbit_nodes => [ $controller_node_public, ],

commit_message:
Revert "Remove hardcoded foreign keys from db.catalog.api"

It uses SqlAlchemy 0.8, which doesn't fit global requirement
sqlalchemy>=0.7.8.

This reverts commit f960c88209c78bc4075de70a10231552748dbff9.

Change-Id: I97ca02519856e2c183af6c8e0b7f4731b94490f9

commit_message:
Drop murano-paste.ini configuration

murano-paste.ini should be used 'as is' and should not be modified.

Change-Id: I3da0b8641247f6e6ea0949d844dd6c62b9649d9d
Closes-bug: #1312106

Implements: blueprint murano-repository-ha
"}]
commit_message:
Add ha_nodes option to murano-repository

This patch adds support for 'ha_nodes' option
of Murano Repository service. This
options should contain a string with
all controller nodes and service ports.

For example:
ha_nodes = node-1:8084, node-2:8084, node-3:8084

Port 8084 will be listened by other controllers
and any changes made will be replicated to all
other controllers.

Firewall should be opend to allow this port
to be accessed by other controllers through
the management network.

The Repository service uses Keystone's auth
tokens for authentificetion on other
controller nodes.

nodes_to_node_port_list function generates
this string from the array of controller nodes.

Change-Id: Iba68d14e9732fe8f53b869869dfc529392d88686
Implements: blueprint murano-repository-ha

commit_message:
vmware: Remove deprecation warning from VC driver

The vCenter vmdk driver prints a deprecation warning for ESX vmdk driver.
This change removes that deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I90c00c08ae7b8e5507308de8d0bec32f8683a1d0
Closes-Bug: #1293960

commit_message:
skip the quota enforcement test for swift

this test is racing because by the time the large object upload
happens the quota update might not yet have propogated in swift.
As it's unclear if this is a swift bug or tempest assuming too
much, skipping is best for now.

Change-Id: I0c0a5fc5a23125a9c51e220ae5a1218c6e9ca075
Related-Bug: #1310597

commit_message:
Post oslo.messaging fixes

If rpc isn't inited before attempting to load the backend backends relying on
rpc will fail. For Central this should happen at the start of the __init__.

Also the agent_api should be a attribute on the backend object rather then a
module variable.

Pass the domain in the create_domain call in the rpc backend.

Change-Id: I85445963b091d1fbed33c132ae372e3f90cb0c68

commit_message:
Add verify option to image-download

Allow users to verify that the image they have downloaded has come across the
wire correctly. Perform the MD5 check as the file is written out, so we do not
need to read it into memory again.

Change-Id: If80a1f3edeff41463218388555a61f15279277da

commit_message:
Use config baremetal seed ip addr not 192.0.2.1

Instead of using a hardcoded 192.0.2.1 address, extract the baremetal
 ip address from the config with os-apply-config, and use this when
 removing the ssh key, so that new seed instances have a new ssh key.
The intent here is to start the way towards configurable bare metal
seed addresses.

Change-Id: I2c1f19c8dbcbbcdf40f9a8f78e904f9133fd32c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/76/87276/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export no_proxy=${no_proxy:-},$(os-apply-config --type raw -m $TE_DATAFILE --key baremetal-network.seed.ip --key-default '192.0.2.1')

commit_message:
murano-ci jobs and scripts were added

- added Jenkins Jobs configuration files
- added scripts that are used by Jenkins jobs

Change-Id: I277a7e17723f5ad39fbda39d035f4a345bcccbef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-deployment refs/changes/84/89584/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job: name: murano-dashboard-master-on-commit project-type: freestyle defaults: global description: "This job is managed by Jenkins Job Builder, do not edit it through WebUI." disabled: false concurrent: true node: precise properties: - zeromq-event builders: - shell: "git clone https://github.com/stackforge/murano-deployment .\ \nbash -x murano-ci/scripts/murano-dashboard-master-on-commit.sh" publishers: - console-log

commit_message:
Remove unused variable

o neutron/services/firewall/drivers/linux/iptables_fwaas.py:FWAAS_CHAIN
  = 'fwaas'

  This variable was added in the following commit.

    commit 7e487160867d2c2059d556d0d3af50bc8e8838fa
    Author: Rajesh Mohan <rajesh.mlists@gmail.com>
    Date:   Fri Jun 21 17:55:08 2013 -0700

        Firewall as a Service (FWaaS) Iptables Driver

  But there is no evidence that was used.

Change-Id: I5633e74e2441b71e3dddaa0c2f6a5804778e21e1

Runner Type as consts

missing place of old runner type

commit_message:
Add sort-by option for climateclient list commands

Adding a sort-by parameter for the climateclient list command so that
when a list is retrieved, it will be order by the column that the user
prefered.
Default value will be 'name' for leases and 'hypervisor_hostname' for
hosts (which are more meaningful order attributes than id).

Change-Id: Ie6a4df384770123ec5fc4cf43823ce5ef1a47ca5
Closes-Bug: #1304595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-blazarclient refs/changes/49/87949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self, sort_by=None): leases = self._get('/leases', 'leases') if sort_by: leases = sorted(leases, key=lambda l: l[sort_by]) return leases

commit_message:
correct production check for venv paths

Sets venv path to /usr for docker
production environments. Fixes
deployment of OSTF.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: Iae7b621fc73221533bad867d2dc523bdb1ea304d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/80/88580/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $production != 'dev'{

nova.virt.baremetal.virtual_power_driver.VirtualPowerManager

commit_message:
SSH key and virtual_power_driver not used on H/W

For nova baremetal we only need the ssh details when using the
nova.virt.baremetal.virtual_power_driver.VirtualPowerManager
power driver.

Closes-Bug: #1296847
Change-Id: I585a7503eeb2521a944dcfddc22c025a5bce9b3f

commit_message:
Fixes incorrect processing of deleting metadata

When a non-admin tries to delete metadata from a marked image,
they are correctly getting an error message, however they are
also getting a success message when they shouldn't. This code
fixes the incorrect success message.

Closes-Bug: #1308519
Change-Id: I909551365b4a92675d26c1da754e586685a4aa32

commit_message:
ssh instance validation add options for Neutron

This is the first part of the patch series which
 implements multiple ssh instance validation strategy.

This patch adds the new config options and have the effected
test classes to prepare the basic neutron resources for usage.

The default is using the fixed ips for connection, but
on the devstack side the configuration options are configured,
for neutron usage.

Change-Id: Ic5fc9bd1f7407d3430fcd33b03a226deed696d57
Implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy

commit_message:
Make instance_exists() take an instance, not instance_name

Some virt drivers may not support/need to use instance.name and have
a different way to find out if an instance exists. NOTE: this still
uses dict access on instance, as the _run_instance() path is not
converted to Instance objects yet.

NOTE: This also removes a duplicate call to self._lookup_by_name()
in libvirt's resume_state_on_host_boot(). It was calling
self.instance_exists() and then self._lookup_by_name(), but instance_exists()
calls _lookup_by_name() itself.

Change-Id: I701cb5416ec47262268d1a088018b6be2774d1c5

commit_message:
Fix H302 violations in extensions package

H302 violation is reported by flake8 when importing separated objects from
modules instead of importing the whole module.
e.g.   from package.module import function
       function()
is changed to
       from package import module
       module.function()

Change-Id: I570eeee2a7633c1590b54ac98b411a71fc9d4f4e
Partial-Bug: #1291032

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-23 12:17:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6cf1cee85a4d68b03c055a37ba01f834c03d3387', 'message': "fix test_compute_with_volumes

The test_integration_1 test was waiting on volume being in an
'in-use' state before proceeding. However the 'in-use' state
doesn't actually mean that the volume is attached, as 'attaching'
gets mapped to 'in-use' in nova.

This makes it possible for the test to proceed when the volume is
in an attaching state, and not actually ever attached. Which means
you can get to the detach phase on an non attached volume, and
thus explode.

This is even further complicated by the fact that 'in-use' doesn't
appear to be a valid EC2 volume state. The states I could find are
'available', 'attached', 'attaching', 'detaching'.

The fix is in 2 parts. The first is making this test case handle
either 'in-use' or 'attached' as valid states. This doesn't
fix the bug, however it allows us to change the state mapping in
Nova to provide 'attached' when appropriate.

In the process, make the test name something that's actually
descriptive for what it does.

Related-Bug: #1302774

Change-Id: Iaeb6a42a39b4adf8cb4bdff64efe00bf14821725
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-23 15:36:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/1f40d52810b90d219ca43e9deca798c5c32b907e', 'message': "fix test_compute_with_volumes

The test_integration_1 test was waiting on volume being in an
'in-use' state before proceeding. However the 'in-use' state
doesn't actually mean that the volume is attached, as 'attaching'
gets mapped to 'in-use' in nova.

This makes it possible for the test to proceed when the volume is
in an attaching state, and not actually ever attached. Which means
you can get to the detach phase on an non attached volume, and
thus explode.

Use the attachment status to filter out when then volume is not
actually ready.

In the process, make the test name something that's actually
descriptive for what it does.

Related-Bug: #1302774

Change-Id: Iaeb6a42a39b4adf8cb4bdff64efe00bf14821725
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-23 15:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test_ec2_instance_run.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/3b563355ec49568b4c1098a0915527b107359056', 'message': "fix test_compute_with_volumes

The test_integration_1 test was waiting on volume being in an
'in-use' state before proceeding. However the 'in-use' state
doesn't actually mean that the volume is attached, as 'attaching'
gets mapped to 'in-use' in nova.

This makes it possible for the test to proceed when the volume is
in an attaching state, and not actually ever attached. Which means
you can get to the detach phase on an non attached volume, and

Use the attachment status to filter out when then volume is not

In the process, make the test name something that's actually

commit_message:
fix test_compute_with_volumes

The test_integration_1 test was waiting on volume being in an
'in-use' state before proceeding. However the 'in-use' state
doesn't actually mean that the volume is attached, as 'attaching'
gets mapped to 'in-use' in nova.

This makes it possible for the test to proceed when the volume is
in an attaching state, and not actually ever attached. Which means
you can get to the detach phase on an non attached volume, and
thus explode.

Use the attachment status to filter out when then volume is not
actually ready.

In the process, make the test name something that's actually
descriptive for what it does.

Related-Bug: #1302774

Change-Id: Iaeb6a42a39b4adf8cb4bdff64efe00bf14821725

The volumes portion is especially # sensitive. @test.skip(because='1302774')

commit_message:
Rename all visible mentions of "Service" to "Applications"

No we use "Application" term in Application Catalog. Some "Service"s
in Environments panel should be rename to "Component", but in a
separate commit.

commit_message:
kill all proceses inside all l3-agent's net.namespaces,

that using ip protocol. When l3 agent start/stop.
Also remove unnided namespaces.

Change-Id: I7e5203f6cec646a8b70609f2bf3b785066068aeb
Closes-Bug: #1310926
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/72/89872/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_ns_list() { local rv=`ip netns list | grep -Ee "^qrouter-.*"` echo $rv } get_pid_list_for_ns_list() { # the first parameter is a list of ns names for searching pids local ns_list="$1" local pids=`for netns in $ns_list ; do ip netns exec $netns lsof -n -i -t ; done` echo $pids } # kill processes inside network namespaces ns_list=`get_ns_list` # kill all proceses from all dhcp-agent's net.namespaces, that using ip count=3 # we will try kill process 3 times while [ $count -gt 0 ]; do # we can't use ps, because ps can't select processes for given network namespace inside_ns_pids=`get_pid_list_for_ns_list $ns_list` if [ -z "$inside_ns_pids" ] ; then break fi for ns_pid in $inside_ns_pids ; do ocf_run kill $ns_pid done sleep 1 count=$(($count - 1)) done # kill all remaining proceses, that not died by simple kill inside_ns_pids=`get_pid_list_for_ns_list $ns_list` if [ ! -z "$inside_ns_pids" ] ; then for ns_pid in $inside_ns_pids ; do ocf_run kill -9 $ns_pid done fi # cleanup network interfacesclean_up_namespaces() { # kill unnided network namespaces. # # Be carefully. In each network namespace shouldn't be any processes # using network!!! use clean_up before it ns_list=`get_ns_list` if [ ! -z "$ns_list" ] ; then for ns_name in $ns_list ; do ocf_run ip --force netns del $ns_name done fi } sleep 1 clean_up_namespaces sleep 1 clean_up_namespaces sleep 1 clean_up_namespaces

commit_message:
Live migrate all running instances from the host

Blueprint for live-migration of all running instances from the host

Change-Id: I59f85aa334eba6d3b1a084000cd7c1b48e974f75
Implements: blueprint host-servers-live-migrate
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/20/88320/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Live migrate all running instances from the host ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+spec/host-servers-live-migrate The aim of this feature is to allow Operators in only one command to live migrate all running instances from the host to another host. Problem description =================== In order to perform a maintenance operation on a host without service interruption for customers, Openstack Operator needs to live-migrate one by one each running instance from the host. To facilitate this operation, we propose a wrapper in python-novaclient that would just live-migrate all running instances of the entire host to other hosts. Proposed feature is similar to host-evacuate [1] and host-servers-migrate [2]. Proposed change =============== Since the live-migration action name changes for Nova API v3 (``os-migrateLive`` for V2 and ``migrate_live`` for V3), the proposed change will add two feature implementations. The live-migration optional arguments ``--block-migrate`` and ``--disk-over-commit`` will be used in same manner. The optional positional argument ``host`` will be renamed in ``--target_host <target_host>``. New positional argument ``host`` will be used in order to designate compute node name. Alternatives ------------ In order to avoid multiple calls from client, the alternative would be to implement this feature in Nova. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The user can trigger this feature by: ``nova host-servers-live-migrate host`` Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: arezmerita Work Items ---------- * Implement the feature for Nova API V2 * Implement the feature for Nova API V3 Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Since live-migration feature is already well covered by tempest tests, we think that unit tests are sufficient. Documentation Impact ==================== OpenStack Command-Line Interface Reference must be updated in order to add new command in Compute command-line client. References ========== .. [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+spec/evacuate-host .. [2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+spec/host-servers-migrate

commit_message:
correcting the elements sequence for centos+hdp+plain+debug

When creating a centos image with the hdp plain plugin and with debug
mode on the root password is not set correctly. This change fixes the
element sequence.

Changes
* renaming the elements sequence variable for centos hdp plain images

Change-Id: I9e6a46c64cf6239fd6635c2e5673b258a0c4a6fd

commit_message:
Enable keystone token auth and ec2 auth

This patch enables keystone token auth and ec2 auth. Also it enables
keystone support in tempest.

Also, magnetodb section was added to tempest config.

Change-Id: I3e20ab7c66350cbb4a02c5401c43502b3cbaa461
Implements: blueprint keystone-token-validation

commit_message:
Verify addrs only against ports with fixed IPs

To verify a port's mac and IP address, the list of neutron ports is
used. We cannot check against ports without fixed IP addresses, so
exclude them.

Change-Id: Ib81ab42cdbae3132af735b0020ca59d22b71ebaf
Closes-bug: #1300322

Change-Id: I5575c424e5d2c42ee48731eb6bd631c96a5d49d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/45/88145/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random import itertools import urllibfrom swift.obj.diskfile import ASYNCDIR_BASE, get_async_dir, DiskFileManagerfrom swift.common import utils, swobfrom test.unit import debug_logger, patch_policies, mocked_http_conn from swift.common.storage_policy import StoragePolicy, POLICIES, POLICY_INDEX def test_obj_put_conflict(self): ts = itertools.count(int(time())) policy = random.choice(list(POLICIES)) # setup updater conf = { 'devices': self.devices_dir, 'mount_check': 'false', 'swift_dir': self.testdir, } daemon = object_updater.ObjectUpdater(conf, logger=self.logger) async_dir = os.path.join(self.sda1, get_async_dir(policy.idx)) os.mkdir(async_dir) # write an async dfmanager = DiskFileManager(conf, daemon.logger) account, container, obj = 'a', 'c', 'o' op = 'PUT' headers_out = swob.HeaderKeyDict({ 'x-size': 0, 'x-content-type': 'text/plain', 'x-etag': 'd41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e', 'x-timestamp': ts.next(), }) data = {'op': op, 'account': account, 'container': container, 'obj': obj, 'headers': headers_out} dfmanager.pickle_async_update(self.sda1, account, container, obj, data, ts.next(), policy.idx) request_log = [] def capture(*args, **kwargs): request_log.append((args, kwargs)) # run once fake_status_codes = [ 200, # object update success 200, # object update success 409, # object update conflict 200, 200, 200, # enqueue ] with mocked_http_conn(*fake_status_codes, give_connect=capture): daemon.run_once() self.assertEqual(len(fake_status_codes), len(request_log)) for request_args, request_kwargs in request_log[:3]: ip, part, method, path, headers, qs, ssl = request_args self.assertEqual(method, 'PUT') self.assertEqual(headers[POLICY_INDEX], str(policy.idx)) for request_args, request_kwargs in request_log[3:]: ip, part, method, path, headers, qs, ssl = request_args self.assertEqual(method, 'PUT') device, part, reconciler_account, reconciler_container, q_item = \ utils.split_path(path, maxsegs=5, rest_with_last=True) self.assertEqual(reconciler_account, '.misplaced_objects') policy_index, obj_path = urllib.unquote(q_item).split(':', 1) self.assertEqual(policy_index, str(policy.idx)) expected_path = '/%s/%s/%s' % (account, container, obj) self.assertEqual(obj_path, expected_path) self.assertEqual(daemon.logger.get_increment_counts(), {'successes': 1, 'unlinks': 1, 'async_pendings': 1})

commit_message:
Ensure that cached token is not revoked

We need to ensure that tokens won't stay in cache after they have been
revoked.

Changed default revocation_cache_time 300 -> 10 seconds.
revocation_cache_time has to be << than token_cache_time to make token
cache efficient.

Fixes bug #1287301

Change-Id: I14c0eacac3b431c06e40385c891a6636736e5b4a

added_lines: if self._is_token_id_in_revoked_list(token_id): self._cache_store_invalid(token_id) raise InvalidUserToken('Token has been revoked') return self._is_token_id_in_revoked_list(token_id) def _is_token_id_in_revoked_list(self, token_id): """Indicate whether the token_id appears in the revocation list.""" revocation_list = self.token_revocation_list revoked_tokens = revocation_list.get('revoked', []) if not revoked_tokens: return False revoked_ids = (x['id'] for x in revoked_tokens) return token_id in revoked_ids
deleted_lines: revocation_list = self.token_revocation_list revoked_tokens = revocation_list.get('revoked', []) if not revoked_tokens: return revoked_ids = (x['id'] for x in revoked_tokens) for revoked_id in revoked_ids: if token_id == revoked_id: self.LOG.debug('Token %s is marked as having been revoked', token_id) return True return False

commit_message:
safe_setup preserve original trace

When safe_setup reraies the exception the traceback was
replaced by the trace of the re-raise postion.

This change is aiming to preserve the original stack trace,
by saving the original trace and raiseing new exception from the same
type with the original trace.

Change-Id: I16851a0c1d40d7f7253c23f066fa8c19267f4d9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/65/86265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: etype, value, trace = sys.exc_info() try: raise etype(value), None, trace finally: del trace # for avoiding circular refs

commit_message:
Nova should pass device_id='' instead of None to neutron.update_port()

In the case that neutron raises an error and nova needs to undo the api
calls it's done against neutron it should pass device_id='' instead of
None otherwise neutron raises an exception.

Note: This should have a unit test but it's near impossible
to add one right without duplicating all of _stub_allocate_for_instance
due to the fact that it's using some crazy logic in the tests to make
decisions based on an index that's passed it. X.x

Change-Id: I91334c07401ff379f71fdef1d5bd080cc68a72ab
Closes-bug: #1285886
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/77046/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port_req_body = {'port': {'device_id': ''}}

commit_message:
Correct the log in conductor unshelve_instance

The log in conductor unshelve_instance is not correct, this patch
adjust it.

Change-Id: I9706862fa39d3c9cb5af0d412368546b504bc4a5

commit_message:
Fix broken retry tests

* Failure was in output transformer specified in retry_task.yaml.
* Added assertion back to enable the tests.
* Extra logging to include more context in the logs to gather more insight from the logs.

Change-Id: Ic6f4665cd4d74d2676fc17891dbf66984926cd42

subject: Fixed several shell tests on Python3.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 22:53:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/c3bec04485ad2d9b448e79e4a8d58f59502fbaf1', 'message': 'Fixed several shell tests on Python3.

They currently fail because on Python3 arbitrary objects cannot be compared, in
this case, MagicMock and int. In Python2 these comparisons silently pass.

Change-Id: I468c2137702a454365886099e827d329cb1d7209
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed several shell tests on Python3.

They currently fail because on Python3 arbitrary objects cannot be compared, in
this case, MagicMock and int. In Python2 these comparisons silently pass.

Change-Id: I468c2137702a454365886099e827d329cb1d7209

commit_message:
Limited use trusts

Trusts now have a "remaining_uses" field that tracks how many times
a trust can still issue a token. It is decremented by 1 each time a
trust related authentication occurs (call to /auth/tokens), until it
reaches 0 and no token can be issued through this trust anymore. If
set to null (default value), trusts can be used indefinitely to
authenticate.
This is the client side of the implementation.

Closes-Bug: #1250617
Implements: bp trusts-chained-delegation

Change-Id: Ib035a9772b7f035c3a9af102e8e15a860a96a96d

Install Guide: Trove edits

Follow our conventions:
* Wrap long lines in screens.
* Use all-caps for variables.
* Use # su instead of $ sudo su like in other chapters

commit_message:
Add Pcloud support (whole host allocation)

Adds client support for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38156/

Work in progress - posted to support development work on the
corresponding Nova change.

ToDo: Add unit tests

Partly implements blueprint:  whole-host-allocation

Change-Id: Ia1e44b65c7e4917b0855f376a51f85f228221672
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/58/38158/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Pcloud interface.""" from novaclient import base class Pcloud(base.Resource): """An Pcloud is a collection of compute hosts.""" def __repr__(self): return "<Pcloud: %s>" % self.id def add_project(self, project_id): return self.manager.add_project(self, project_id) def remove_project(self, project_id): return self.manager.remove_project(self, project_id) def set_metadata(self, metadata): return self.manager.set_metadata(self, metadata) def delete(self): self.manager.delete(self) class PcloudManager(base.ManagerWithFind): resource_class = Pcloud def list(self): """Get a list of os-pclouds.""" return self._list('/os-pclouds', 'pclouds') def create(self, name): """Create a new pcloud.""" body = {'pcloud': {'name': name}} return self._create('/os-pclouds', body, 'pcloud') def get_details(self, pcloud): """Get details of the specified pcloud.""" return self._get('/os-pclouds/%s' % (base.getid(pcloud)), "pcloudInfo") def add_project(self, pcloud, project_id): """Authorize a project to use a Pcloud.""" body = {'add_project': {'project_id': project_id}} return self._create("/os-pclouds/%s/action" % base.getid(pcloud), body, "pcloud") def remove_project(self, pcloud, project_id): """Remove authorization for a project to use a Pcloud.""" body = {'remove_project': {'project_id': project_id}} return self._create("/os-pclouds/%s/action" % base.getid(pcloud), body, "pcloud") def delete(self, pcloud): """Delete the specified pcloud.""" self._delete('/os-pclouds/%s' % (base.getid(pcloud)))

subject: Better error message handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 10:23:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b857cf4ec5ed901b426f39c11621b204cfd4fafb', 'message': 'Better error message handling

In OpenStack dashboard, error messages that pop up to end users
present several problems:
 * When they are based on exception message,
   they are often too technical and/or not helpful.
 * When they are set by horizon code, they cannot
   (without changing source code) be customized by cloud
   providers (that may want to adapt them to their business rules)

This patch is a first attempt to address this problem.
It's a work in progress and we hope it will be a good
start for discussions and early feedbacks.

How does it work:
 * It adds an adapter class called HTMLException:
   it's aimed to be the HTML part of an exception.
   HTMLException wrap python exceptions when it happen and provides a
   method called "render" that knows how to render
   the underlying exception object.

 * When an exception is being rendered, the render method will
   look up for a django templates (for that, it tries to map
   the exception class name to a template name),
   if no specific template for that class of exception in defined,
   it falls back to a default template.

 * Templates are created under a directory called "exceptions",
   "base" and "default" template can be provided by OpenStack dashboard,
   when specific exceptions templates may be defined by users
   throw another Django application. (we include specific template
   in this patch mainly for example).

 * To be flexible on how to render an exception,
   templates will get in their context:
     * The exception object being raised
     * The exception class
     * The exception traceback.
     * Error message set in horizon source code (if any).

Partially implements: improve-error-message-details-for-usability

Change-Id: If634c684769f1b865d35568cb2e9747108f0012a

commit_message:
Better error message handling

In OpenStack dashboard, error messages that pop up to end users
present several problems:
 * When they are based on exception message,
   they are often too technical and/or not helpful.
 * When they are set by horizon code, they cannot
   (without changing source code) be customized by cloud
   providers (that may want to adapt them to their business rules)

This patch is a first attempt to address this problem.
It's a work in progress and we hope it will be a good
start for discussions and early feedbacks.

How does it work:
 * It adds an adapter class called HTMLException:
   it's aimed to be the HTML part of an exception.
   HTMLException wrap python exceptions when it happen and provides a
   method called "render" that knows how to render
   the underlying exception object.

 * When an exception is being rendered, the render method will
   look up for a django templates (for that, it tries to map
   the exception class name to a template name),
   if no specific template for that class of exception in defined,
   it falls back to a default template.

 * Templates are created under a directory called "exceptions",
   "base" and "default" template can be provided by OpenStack dashboard,
   when specific exceptions templates may be defined by users
   throw another Django application. (we include specific template
   in this patch mainly for example).

 * To be flexible on how to render an exception,
   templates will get in their context:
     * The exception object being raised
     * The exception class
     * The exception traceback.
     * Error message set in horizon source code (if any).

Partially implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability

Change-Id: If634c684769f1b865d35568cb2e9747108f0012a

commit_message:
Add tox -e genconfic for sample conf generation

This patch adds tox -e genconfic in pbr so we can generate the
removed sample config files in sdist so that they can be included
in the release tarball. The sample file was removed in nova in
2a005208a2c86d69ac461d72e54c53bd395cf

Closes-bug: #1301519

Change-Id: I171d19da917182719e6135c9ee8cf61feac06a90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/07/85207/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = self.distribution.get_name() sample_config_file = genconfig(name) if sample_config_file is not None: self.filelist.append(sample_config_file) """Builds the ChangeLog, Authors files and sample config from VC first."""def genconfig(project_name): """Tries to generate a .conf.sample file for projects (e.g. nova) that removed it and need to generate it in sdist so it will be included in the dist tarrball. """ try: import tox except ImportError: return sample_config_file = ('etc/%(name)s/%(name)s.conf.sample' % {'name': project_name}) if not os.path.exists(sample_config_file): try: tox.cmdline(args=['-e', 'genconfig']) return sample_config_file except: # die silently for projects that don't have a config sample file, # or that don't include the generation script return

commit_message:
Support floating IP association at provisioning

Reasons:
 - floating ip assocaition is required for
   the access into the instances from the WAN.

Changes:
 - adding floating IP association on provisioning.

Change-Id: I7da0e1460f7e06f72a84cfa2ad7518acfcb812a7
Implements: blueprint floating-ip-support

commit_message:
Added help button for modal forms

*** Help button has the same size/look as the quit button

*** We are currently changing the look n feel of the modal
    forms since we are loosing a great portion of the page for the
    help text which is not always required (also prevent us from making
    the layout horizon). So, we are making the help text toggable.

*** Also for now, only the project/images_and_snapshots page is different.
    All other modals are the same for now.

Implements: blueprint horizon-modal-help
Change-Id: Iea3a232e53c233a7ddf6870043d11fe1408ddab4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/37/76937/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* css for modal help button */ .modal-header .help, .modal-header .close { padding: 9px; margin-top: -9px; padding-bottom: 18px; } .modal-header .help { float: right; font-size: 20px; font-weight: bold; line-height: @baseLineHeight; color: @black; text-shadow: 0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,1); .opacity(20); &:hover { color: @black; text-decoration: none; .opacity(40); cursor: pointer; } } /* .help.selected { background-color: lightgray; border-bottom: lightgray solid 1px; opacity: 100 !important; } .show.description { background-color: lightgray; } */

commit_message:
WIP: Wrapper for WaitForUpdatesEx in Vmware Vsphere SDK

Calculate the set of updates for each existing filter in the session.
Return UpdateSet since the passed in version or null if there are no
changes.

Change-Id: Iae04b7b2780a7f4d7b37d48368eb39a43da14f7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/36/78836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_objects_wfu(vim, type_, max_objects, properties_to_collect=None, all_properties=False): """Get all managed object references of the given type. It is the caller's responsibility to continue or cancel retrieval. :param vim: Vim object :param type_: type of the managed object :param max_objects: maximum number of objects that should be returned in a single call :param properties_to_collect: names of the managed object properties to be collected :param all_properties: whether all properties of the managed object need to be collected :returns: all managed object references of the given type """ if not properties_to_collect: properties_to_collect = ['name'] client_factory = vim.client.factory recur_trav_spec = build_recursive_traversal_spec(client_factory) object_spec = build_object_spec(client_factory, vim.service_content.rootFolder, [recur_trav_spec]) property_spec = build_property_spec( client_factory, type_=type_, properties_to_collect=properties_to_collect, all_properties=all_properties) property_filter_spec = build_property_filter_spec(client_factory, [property_spec], [object_spec]) options = client_factory.create('ns0:WaitOptions') options.maxObjectUpdates=3 options.maxWaitSeconds=12 property_collecotr=vim.service_content.propertyCollector vim.CreateFilter(property_collecotr, spec=property_filter_spec, partialUpdates=False) return vim.WaitForUpdatesEx(property_collecotr, options=options) def get_object_property_wfu(vim, moref, property_name): """Get property of the given managed object. :param vim: Vim object :param moref: managed object reference :param property_name: name of the property to be retrieved :returns: property of the given managed object """ update_set = get_object_properties_wfu(vim, moref, [property_name]) prop_val = None if update_set: #result.filterSet[0].objectSet[0].changeSet[0].val.HostPortGroup[0].spec.name return update_set.filterSet[0].objectSet[0].changeSet[0].val, update_set.version return [], '' def get_object_properties_wfu(vim, moref, properties_to_collect): """Get properties of the given managed object. :param vim: Vim object :param moref: managed object reference :param properties_to_collect: names of the managed object properties to be collected :returns: properties of the given managed object """ if moref is None: return None client_factory = vim.client.factory all_properties = (properties_to_collect is None or len(properties_to_collect) == 0) property_spec = build_property_spec( client_factory, type_=moref._type, properties_to_collect=properties_to_collect, all_properties=all_properties) object_spec = build_object_spec(client_factory, moref, []) property_filter_spec = build_property_filter_spec(client_factory, [property_spec], [object_spec]) options = client_factory.create('ns0:WaitOptions') options.maxObjectUpdates=3 options.maxWaitSeconds=12 property_collecotr=vim.service_content.propertyCollector vim.CreateFilter(property_collecotr, spec=property_filter_spec, partialUpdates=False) retrieve_result = vim.WaitForUpdatesEx(property_collecotr, options=options) return retrieve_result

Clean up of duplicated mandatory fields logic in JsonPatchType

Removed mandatory fields validation from JsonPatchType since
WSME is now handling this.

commit_message:
support for external nova drivers to add nova rootwrap.d files

this makes it easier for non-integrated nova drivers to add
files into nova's rootwrap.d directory.

Change-Id: Ib78e3f62c1ebff875f92c23abb1ee2d5f0e0e74f

commit_message:
Cleanup glance/common/client.py(F821)

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12619/1,  The define of
"SendFileIterator"/"ImageBodyIterator" were deleted.
But related statements are left.
 (e.g. return ImageBodyIterator(body) and so on)

This patch clean up left statements and so on.

Also, PEP error "F821" will be fixed.

Change-Id: I1caec0ca2094115b5c9383b7c50d09b5f8e0730b
Closes-Bug: #1206845

added_lines: if header.lower() != 'content-length': _chunkbody(c, iter) return utils.chunkreadable(body)
deleted_lines: try: import sendfile # noqa SENDFILE_SUPPORTED = True except ImportError: SENDFILE_SUPPORTED = False def _sendbody(connection, iter): connection.endheaders() for sent in iter: # iterator has done the heavy lifting pass use_sendfile = self._sendable(body) if use_sendfile or header.lower() != 'content-length': if use_sendfile: # send actual file without copying into userspace _sendbody(c, iter) else: # otherwise iterate and chunk _chunkbody(c, iter) def _sendable(self, body): return (SENDFILE_SUPPORTED and hasattr(body, 'fileno') and self._seekable(body) and not self.use_ssl) if self._sendable(body): return SendFileIterator(connection, body) elif self._iterable(body): return utils.chunkreadable(body) else: return ImageBodyIterator(body)

commit_message:
Add optional spell checker target

Add a tox target using sphinxcontrib-spelling to let
authors run a spell checker against documents before
submitting them.

Change-Id: If519fb63bc4b0923a48df9e0435125fd66ab5c0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/47/88047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
