commit_message:
Improvements to the Trove Install Doc

Fixed procedural + formatting issues with the Trove Install
Doc.

Change-Id: I0d54875af34b032e741d7d4071a4de8c77239e47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/25/88225/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <step> <para>Install required packages:</para> <screen os="ubuntu;debian"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>apt-get install python-trove python-troveclient python-glanceclient \ trove-common trove-api trove-taskmanager</userinput></screen> <screen os="rhel;centos;fedora"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>yum install openstack-trove FIXME</userinput></screen> <screen os="opensuse;sles"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>zypper install openstack-trove python-troveclient</userinput></screen> <step> <para>Prepare OpenStack:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Source the <filename>admin-openrc.sh</filename> file.</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>source ~/admin-openrc.sh</userinput></screen> </step> <step os="rhel;centos;fedora;opensuse;sles;ubuntu"> <para>Create a <literal>trove</literal> user that Compute uses to authenticate with the Identity service. Use the <literal>service</literal> tenant and give the user the <literal>admin</literal> role: </para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-create --name=trove --pass=<replaceable>TROVE_PASS</replaceable> --email=<replaceable>trove@example.com</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-role-add --user=trove --tenant=service --role=admin</userinput></screen> </step> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Edit the the following configuration files, taking the below actions for each file:</para> <itemizedlist> </itemizedlist> <substeps> <step><para>Edit the <literal>[DEFAULT]</literal> section of each file and set appropriate values for the OpenStack service URLs, logging configuration, and RabbitMQ and SQL connections</para>rabbit_password = <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable> sql_connection = trove:<literal>TROVE_DBPASS</literal>@controller/trove notifier_queue_hostname = controller </substeps> <step> <para>Edit the <literal>[filter:authtoken]</literal> section of the api-paste.ini file so it matches the listing shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini"> [filter:authtoken]admin_token = TROVE_TOKENsigning_dir = /var/cache/trove </programlisting> </step> <step><para>Edit the <filename>trove.conf</filename> file so it includes appropriate values for the default datastore and network label regex as shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[DEFAULT] </programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Edit the <filename>trove-taskmanager.conf</filename> file so it includes the appropriate service credentials required to connect to the OpenStack Compute Nova service as shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[DEFAULT]... </programlisting> <step> <para>Prepare the trove admin database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>mysql -u root -p</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>CREATE DATABASE trove;</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS';</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS';</userinput></screen> </step> <step> <para>Prepare the Database service:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Initialize the database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo su -s /bin/sh -c "trove-manage db_sync" trove</userinput></screen> </step> <step> <para>Create a datastore. You need to create a separate datastore for each type of database you want to use, for example, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra. This example shows you how to create a datastore for a MySQL database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo su -s /bin/sh -c "trove-manage datastore_update mysql''" trove</userinput></screen> </step> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Create a trove image.</para> <para>Create an image for the type of database you want to use, for example, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra.</para> <para>This image must have the trove guest agent installed, and it must have the <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename> file configured to connect to your OpenStack environment. To correctly configure the <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename> file, do these steps on the guest instance you are using to build your image:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Add the following lines to <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename>:</para> <programlisting language="ini">rabbit_host = controller rabbit_password = <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Update the datastore to use the new image, using the <command>trove-manage</command> command.</para> <para>This example shows you how to create a MySQL 5.5 datastore:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>trove-manage --config-file=/etc/trove/trove.conf datastore_version_update \ mysql mysql-5.5 mysql <replaceable>glance_image_ID</replaceable> mysql-server-5.5 1</userinput></screen> </step> that other OpenStack services can locate it. Register the service and specify the endpoint:</para> --description="OpenStack Database Service"</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>keystone endpoint-create \ --service-id=$(keystone service-list | awk '/ trove / {print $2}') \ --publicurl=http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:8779/v1.0/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --internalurl=http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:8779/v1.0/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --adminurl=http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:8779/v1.0/%\(tenant_id\)s</userinput></screen> services and configure them to start when the system <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>service trove-taskmanager restart</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>service trove-conductor restart</userinput></screen> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>service openstack-trove-taskmanager start</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>service openstack-trove-conductor start</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>chkconfig openstack-trove-api on</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>chkconfig openstack-trove-taskmanager on</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>chkconfig openstack-trove-conductor on</userinput></screen>
deleted_lines: <step> <para>Install required packages:</para> <screen os="ubuntu;debian"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>apt-get install python-trove python-troveclient python-glanceclient \ trove-common trove-api trove-taskmanager</userinput></screen> <screen os="rhel;centos;fedora"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>yum install openstack-trove FIXME</userinput></screen> <screen os="opensuse;sles"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>zypper install openstack-trove python-troveclient</userinput></screen> </step> <step><para>Prepare OpenStack:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Source the <filename>admin-openrc.sh</filename> file.</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>source ~/admin-openrc.sh</userinput></screen> </step> <step os="rhel;centos;fedora;opensuse;sles;ubuntu"> <para>Create a <literal>trove</literal> user that Compute uses to authenticate with the Identity service. Use the <literal>service</literal> tenant and give the user the <literal>admin</literal> role:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-create --name=trove --pass=<replaceable>TROVE_PASS</replaceable> --email=<replaceable>trove@example.com</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-role-add --user=trove --tenant=service --role=admin</userinput></screen> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Edit the the following configuration files, taking the below actions for each file:</para> <itemizedlist> </itemizedlist> <substeps> <step><para>Edit the <literal>[DEFAULT]</literal> section of each file for the, client URLs and logging configuration</para> <step os="fedora;rhel;centos"> <para>Set these configuration keys to configure thee Database module to use the Qpid message broker:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-api.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-taskmaster.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-api.conf DEFAULT qpid_hostname <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-taskmaster.conf DEFAULT qpid_hostname <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf DEFAULT qpid_hostname <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> </screen> </step> <step os="ubuntu"> <para>Configure the Database module to use the RabbitMQ message broker by setting these configuration keys in the <literal>[DEFAULT]</literal> configuration group of each file:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[DEFAULT] ... rpc_backend = rabbit rabbit_host = controller rabbit_password = <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable></programlisting> </step> <step os="opensuse;sles"> <para>Set these configuration keys to configure the Database module to use the RabbitMQ message broker:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-api.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-taskmaster.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf \ DEFAULT rpc_backend rabbit</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-api.conf DEFAULT rabbit_host controller</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-taskmaster.conf DEFAULT rabbit_host controller</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf DEFAULT rabbit_host controller</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-api.conf DEFAULT rabbit_password <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-taskmaster.conf DEFAULT rabbit_password <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf DEFAULT rabbit_password <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable></userinput></screen> <step> <para>Edit the <literal>[keystone_authtoken]</literal> section of each file so it matches the listing shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini"> [keystone_authtoken]auth_uri = https://controller:5000/v2.0</programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Edit the <literal>[database]</literal> section of each file, adding it if necessary, so it matches the listing shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[database] connection = mysql://trove:<literal>TROVE_DBPASS</literal>@controller/trove </programlisting> </step> </substeps> </step> <step><para>Edit the <filename>trove.conf</filename> file so it matches the listing shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[DEFAULT]# ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = controller</programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Edit the <filename>trove-taskmanager.conf</filename> file so it matches the listing shown below:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[DEFAULT].... # ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = controller ...</programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Create a <filename>trove_nolog.conf</filename> file:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>cp /etc/trove/trove.conf /etc/trove/trove_nolog.conf</userinput></screen> <para>Edit the <filename>trove_nolog.conf</filename> file:</para> <programlisting language="ini"># remove line starting with logdir and add use_syslog=False</programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Prepare the trove admin database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>mysql -u root -p</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>CREATE DATABASE trove;</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS';</userinput> <prompt>mysql></prompt> <userinput>GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS';</userinput></screen> <step><para>Prepare the Database service:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Initialize the database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>trove-manage --config-file=/etc/trove/trove_nolog.conf db_sync</userinput></screen> </step> <step> <para>Create a datastore. You need to create a separate datastore for each type of database you want to use, for example, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra. This example shows you how to create a datastore for a MySQL database:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>trove-manage --config-file=/etc/trove/trove_nolog.conf datastore_update mysql ""</userinput></screen> </step> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Create a trove image.</para> <para>Create an image for the type of database you want to use, for example, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra.</para> <para>This image must have the trove guest agent installed, and it must have the <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename> file configured to connect to your OpenStack environment. To correctly configure the <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename> file, do these steps on the guest instance you are using to build your image:</para> <substeps> <step> <para>Add the following lines to <filename>trove-guestagent.conf</filename>:</para> <programlisting language="ini">rabbit_host = controller rabbit_password = <replaceable>RABBIT_PASS</replaceable> </substeps> </step> <step> <para>Update the datastore to use the new image, using the <command>trove-manage</command> command.</para> <para>This example shows you how to create a MySQL 5.5 datastore:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>trove-manage --config-file=/etc/trove/trove.conf datastore_version_update \ mysql mysql-5.5 mysql <replaceable>glance_image_ID</replaceable> mysql-server-5.5 1</userinput></screen> </step> that other OpenStack services can locate it. commit_message:
Adds HTTPS support for Compute metadata

Adds metadata https configuration settings to the Compute security
hardening section.

Change-Id: I7524f7c5567f1cc34553e67bc314c414320591a4
Closes-Bug: 1310862
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/85/89485/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="section_compute_metadata_https"> <title>Encrypt Compute metadata traffic</title> <para>OpenStack Juno supports encrypting Compute metadata traffic with HTTPS. Enable SSL encryption in the <filename>metadata_agent.ini</filename> file:<orderedlist> <listitem> <para>Enable the HTTPS protocol: <programlisting>nova_metadata_protocol = https</programlisting> </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Determine whether insecure SSL connections are accepted for Compute metadata server requests. The default value is <option>False</option>: <programlisting>nova_metadata_insecure = False</programlisting></para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Specify the path to the client certificate: <programlisting> nova_client_cert = <path to cert></programlisting></para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Specify the path to the private key: <programlisting> nova_client_priv_key = <path to private key></programlisting></para> </listitem> </orderedlist></para> </section>

commit_message:
Added scheduler filter AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation

Added new scheduler filter AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation
with example and conf-file properties. Also updated default
filter line to match current nova.conf file.
Added ceilometer.conf back into common; telemetry project
has gotten rid of their sample file so could no longer link
to it (and could not build without).

Closes-bug: #1308333

Change-Id: I11c9248756c22fa2980d539c7186c1cf41f48afc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/65/89465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>The <literal>scheduler_default_filters</literal> configuration option in <filename>nova.conf</filename> defines the list of filters that are applied by the <systemitem class="service">nova-scheduler</systemitem> service. The default filters are:</para> <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_default_filters=RetryFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter,CoreFilter</programlisting> <section xml:id="aggregateimagepropertiesisolationfilter"> <title>AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation</title> <para>Matches properties defined in an image's metadata against those of aggregates to determine host matches:</para> <para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>If a host belongs to an aggregate and the aggregate defines one or more metadata that match an image's properties, that host is a candidate to boot the image's instance.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>If a host does not belong to any aggregate, it can boot instances from all images.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </para> <para>For example, the following aggregate <systemitem>myWinAgg</systemitem> has the Windows operating system as metadata:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nova aggregate-details MyWinAgg</userinput> <computeroutput>+----+----------+-------------------+------------+--------------+ | Id | Name | Availability Zone | Hosts | Metadata | +----+----------+-------------------+------------+--------------+ | 1 | MyWinAgg | None | 'sf-devel' | 'os=windows' | +----+----------+-------------------+------------+--------------+</computeroutput></screen> <para>In this example, because the following CirrOS image has the <property>windows</property> property, it would boot on the <systemitem>sf-devel</systemitem> host (all other filters being equal):</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>glance image-show cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec</userinput> <computeroutput>+------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property 'os' | windows | | checksum | f8a2eeee2dc65b3d9b6e63678955bd83 | | container_format | ami | | created_at | 2013-11-14T13:24:25 | | ...</computeroutput></screen> <para>You can configure the <systemitem>AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation</systemitem> filter using the following options in the <filename>nova.conf</filename> file: </para> <programlisting language="ini"># Considers only keys matching the given namespace (string). aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace=<None> # Separator used between the namespace and keys (string). aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator=.</programlisting> </section>
deleted_lines: <para>The <literal>scheduler_default_filters</literal> configuration option in <filename>nova.conf</filename> defines the list of filters that are applied by the <systemitem class="service" >nova-scheduler</systemitem> service. As mentioned, the default filters are:</para> <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_default_filters=AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter</programlisting>

commit_message:
Change to use absolute path in load_template()

If we execute the tempest in other path other than the root path of
tempest, the case will failed because can't find the template files.

Change-Id: Ic585546270b2c6d7a42d3128d752217d8d4e3860
Closes-bug: 1300597
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/63/84363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: loc = ["stacks", "templates", "%s.%s" % (name, ext)] fullpath = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__),*loc)

commit_message:
Log Request ID Mappings

Tracking requests across multiple OpenStack services is difficult.
This is a proposal for logging corresponding request IDs together, so users
can easily lookup the request IDs of services other than the one the user
called directly.

blueprint log-request-id-mappings

Change-Id: Ib9b820a0feeb0c0e828ed3e4fab8261f8761ba9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/03/86403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Log Request ID Mappings ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/log-request-id-mappings Tracking requests across multiple OpenStack services is difficult. Problem description =================== Each OpenStack service has sends a request ID header with HTTP responses. This value can be useful for tracking down problems in the logs. However, when operations cross service boundaries, this tracking becomes difficult, as services generate a new ID for each inbound request; a nova request ID cannot help users find debug info for other services that were called by nova while a request to nova was being fulfilled. This becomes especially problematic when requests are coming in parallel; simply matching timestamps between service logs is no longer a feasible solution. Proposed change =============== A request ID is generated at the start of request processing. This is the ID that the user will see when their request returns. Other OpenStack services that nova calls out to (such as glance) will send responses with their request ID as a header. By logging the mapping of the two request IDs (nova->glance), a user will be able to easily lookup the request ID returned by glance in the n-api log. With the glance request ID in hand, he can then check the glance logs for debug info which corresponds to the request he made to nova. Alternatives ------------ This idea surfaced in previous cycles, with the proposed solution being a unified request ID that would be passed between services. While work was started on this, the approach was eventually deemed unsatisfactory, as it would allow for meddling with the request ID value on the client side. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- The request_utils module used will generate an INFO notification for each request ID mapping that is logged. Other end user impact --------------------- The only places an end user will see this is in the n-api log or in the generated notifications. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- In order for nova to log the request ID value of the other service, the python client for that service needs to be passing back the request ID it gets from the HTTP response from the service. New releases of python-glanceclient, python-cinderclient, etc. will be necessary for this to occur. As such, deployers will need to be running newer versions of the client in order for the request ID mappings to be logged. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chris-buccella Work Items ---------- 1. Sync request_utils module from oslo 2. As various service's python clients are updated to return the request ID, log the request ID mapping using request_utils.link_request_ids(): 1. python-glanceclient 2. python-cinderclient 3. python-neutronclient 3. Update requirements.txt with the new required versions of the clients Dependencies ============ * New versions of some python clients. The following blueprints need to be completed first: * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+spec/return-req-id * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-cinderclient/+spec/return-req-id * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+spec/return-req-id Testing ======= A tempest test could be added to ensure that notifications are being generated in the correct format. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== Discussion from the HK Summit: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/icehouse-summit-nova-cross-project-request-ids Refinements from the ML: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-December/020774.html

commit_message:
Haproxy should listen only on vip

Adding ability for haproxy to listen only on specifically configured
vip interface

It will enable setups where using different ports for balancer service
is not convenient, e.g:

listen horizon
  bind 192.168.0.2:80
  balance  source
  mode  http
  server node-1 192.168.0.3:80 cookie node-1  check inter 2000 fall 3
  server node-2 192.168.0.4:80 cookie node-2  check inter 2000 fall 3
  server node-3 192.168.0.5:80 cookie node-3  check inter 2000 fall 3

Related to blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration

Change-Id: Ifd441a1d5fb50d0cfb16dc4197caf2c1912cf1ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/17/89517/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
XenAPI: Use local rsync rather than remote if possible

Using ssh depends on the host being set up to be able to SSH into
itself which is not a common scenario.  While this is unavoidable for
the current implementation of resize across multiple hosts, if there
is a single host (i.e. a test scenario) or the resize is restricted
to the same host then we can succeed without SSH access

Dependency on Ia310e31d31aaf5c979e41c64af8223202a18e03a is because the
tests will always fail without Ia310 therefore this fix cannot be tested
without taking Ia310 as well.

Closes-bug: 1308064

Change-Id: I15802a1d97d380b1c5b74fc9f92ece2494fe789a

commit_message:
Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound for keypair's API

Gets the "explanation" from HTTPNotFound exception and returns
correct message. the commit Ia784e09cda986a421e83c2820dfd0a2267867cdd
has fixed this kind of bug already, but this bug is remained.

Closes-Bug: #1307338
Change-Id: I6811eecba86938e4253f437b7677cb7e4468fd67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/87828/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.KeypairNotFound as exc: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=exc.format_message()) except exception.KeypairNotFound as exc: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=exc.format_message())
deleted_lines: except exception.KeypairNotFound: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound() except exception.KeypairNotFound: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound()

commit_message:
RabbitMQ - Consistent PID file location

Ubuntu and RabbitMQ's rabbitmq-server packages use different
default PID file locations. We should explicitly choose a single
location to use.

Change-Id: Ia9d1fb55bbca02609396e8f1e163abef61398d54

Remove validate_headers

commit_message:
Added argcomplete requirement

This library will be used in python clients to provide command line
completition

Minimum version is 0.6.8 cause it's the first version that works with
PBR generated scripts

Change-Id: Ia2aaa4cd40ebfa29f1c2135a5c99e67484af6de7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/63/65863/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Keep volume available if retype fails due to quota

If we're over quota for a volume type that we're retyping a volume to,
keep the volume available.

Closes-Bug: #1308819
Change-Id: I7e66e95bf12b7e5a6df04eeb5a501badb5f2941f

commit_message:
XenAPI: Calculate disk_available_least

The disk_available_least item is now needed for the tempest test.
Calculate based on the virtual-allocation from the SR.

Change-Id: I1a08f229de7cd77d4798472c82304247fae290e5
Closes-bug: 1300242

commit_message:
Moved information about processes names to plugins

Names of the processes are highly plugin specific. So, plugin
should handle processes names.

Partially implements: blueprint edp-plugin-communication
Closes-Bug: #1251750

Change-Id: If1f84ce7672763034aadc28871b77fa0ba419adc

commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient v2 test

On assertEqual, the order of parameters should be (expected, observed).
But, some part of glanceclient v2 test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

Partially Close-bug: #1277104

Change-Id: Iae3fb9dda28b67a07f527b15ca83d9cca3e867d4

commit_message:
Fix Sahara auth configs

* auth_ host/port/protocol should use corresponding $KEYSTONE_AUTH_
* add missed auth_ host/port/protocol to [keystone_authtoken]

Change-Id: I0fc6434d552cdd03eb8d886681e57bb374e5bb61

commit_message:
Add helper method to determine disk size from instance properties

Add a _disk_size_from_instance method which by using the disk name
determine the size of the disk refered in the instance properties.
Update the method finish_migration to use this new helper.

Change-Id: I45bd3804fdabff35189421d01a0503c886c24a4c
Related-Bug: #1298975

added_lines: if resize_instance: # resize disks. only "disk" and "disk.local" are necessary. disk_info = jsonutils.loads(disk_info) for info in disk_info: fname = os.path.basename(info['path']) if fname == 'disk': size = instance['root_gb'] elif fname == 'disk.local': size = instance['ephemeral_gb'] else: size = 0 size *= unit.Gi # If we have a non partitioned image that we can extend # then ensure we're in 'raw' format so we can extend # file system. fmt = info['type'] if (size and fmt == 'qcow2' and path_raw = info['path'] + '_raw' utils.execute('qemu-img', 'convert', '-f', 'qcow2', '-O', 'raw', info['path'], path_raw) utils.execute('mv', path_raw, info['path']) fmt = 'raw' if size: use_cow = fmt == 'qcow2' disk.extend(info['path'], size, use_cow=use_cow) if fmt == 'raw' and CONF.use_cow_images: # back to qcow2 (no backing_file though) so that snapshot # will be available path_qcow = info['path'] + '_qcow' utils.execute('qemu-img', 'convert', '-f', 'raw', '-O', 'qcow2', info['path'], path_qcow) utils.execute('mv', path_qcow, info['path'])

commit_message:
Verify delete interface response of V2/V3 APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for response status of Nova interface delete
APIs to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

delete interface does not return the response body.
Response status of above APIs is 202 in v2/v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I8ff4f3e2b8912d29918965b4aa86cf807a9a23ca

Add parametric tests of Swift object API, part 2

Add positive tests of Swift object "GET" API from the viewpoint of
completeness of query parameters.

commit_message:
Xen: Retry plugin call after connection reset

When using the call_plugin_serialized_with_retry session method it will
retry if the plugin raises a RetryableError, but not if it loses the
connection to xenapi.  This adds a retry for the 'Connection reset by
peer' error that is occasionally seen.

Change-Id: Ibb36a0170e0e807ad7a4198df7b6e574c4279bed
Closes-Bug: #1200591
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/89406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import errno import socket from nova import exception class CallPluginTestCase(stubs.XenAPITestBaseNoDB): def _get_fake_xapisession(self): class FakeXapiSession(session.XenAPISession): def __init__(self, **kwargs): "Skip the superclass's dirty init" self.XenAPI = mock.MagicMock() return FakeXapiSession() def setUp(self): super(CallPluginTestCase, self).setUp() self.session = self._get_fake_xapisession() def test_serialized_with_retry_socket_error_conn_reset(self): exc = socket.error exc.errno = errno.ECONNRESET plugin = 'glance' fn = 'download_vhd' num_retries = 1 callback = None with mock.patch.object(self.session, 'call_plugin_serialized', autospec=True) as call_plugin_serialized: call_plugin_serialized.side_effect = exc self.assertRaises(exception.PluginRetriesExceeded, self.session.call_plugin_serialized_with_retry, plugin, fn, num_retries, callback) call_plugin_serialized.assert_called_with(plugin, fn) self.assertEquals(2, call_plugin_serialized.call_count) def test_serialized_with_retry_socket_error_reraised(self): exc = socket.error exc.errno = errno.ECONNREFUSED plugin = 'glance' fn = 'download_vhd' num_retries = 1 callback = None with mock.patch.object(self.session, 'call_plugin_serialized', autospec=True) as call_plugin_serialized: call_plugin_serialized.side_effect = exc self.assertRaises(socket.error, self.session.call_plugin_serialized_with_retry, plugin, fn, num_retries, callback) call_plugin_serialized.assert_called_once_with(plugin, fn)

commit_message:
Disable reverse dns lookup

The BaseHTTPServer will do a reverse dns lookup when log message, which
will cause 10 seconds latency in some network environment. This will
significantly slow down the api request when wsgiref.simple_server is
used.

This patch creates a class, which inherits from
simple_server.WSGIRequestHandler but overrides address_string method,
and passes it to handler_class param of simple_server.make_server.

Change-Id: Ia38c7719ed700ab5867dcc4bcf3700bff282a907
Closes-Bug: #1291229
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/76/79876/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # disable reverse dns query bhs = __import__('BaseHTTPServer') bhs.BaseHTTPRequestHandler.address_string = lambda x: x.client_address[0]

commit_message:
Add basic rpc connection properties

It was not possible to set the RPC connection properties in keystone.
This patch adds attributes for them.

Change-Id: I9f653f924f8f7dcd00d6dd97b655b2b14c9a2620
Closes-Bug: #1310747
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/23/89423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `openstack['identity']["control_exchange"]` - The AMQP exchange to connect to if using RabbitMQ or Qpid, defaults to openstack * `openstack['identity']["rpc_backend"]` - The messaging module to use * `openstack['identity']["rpc_thread_pool_size"]` - Size of RPC thread pool * `openstack['identity']["rpc_conn_pool_size"]` - Size of RPC connection pool * `openstack['identity']["rpc_response_timeout"]` - Seconds to wait for a response from call or multicall

Change-Id: I85c42f8351763da201021a22f5ff0ebd62c6b2db
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-18 01:53:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/image/test_glance.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/993facb3bf753d23332236dc05b397850bf99144', 'message': "Fallback to None on missing Glance image attrs

commit_message:
Fallback to None on missing Glance image attrs

It's possible for glance images to be missing attributes like name and
checksum. We'll just set those to None by default to avoid missing key
exceptions being raised.

Closes-Bug: #1308058
Change-Id: I85c42f8351763da201021a22f5ff0ebd62c6b2db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/89/88089/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'container_format', 'checksum', 'id', 'deleted_at', 'deleted', 'status', for attr in IMAGE_ATTRIBUTES: output[attr] = getattr(image, attr, None)
deleted_lines: #NOTE(hdd): If a key is not found, base.Resource.__getattr__() may perform # a get(), resulting in a useless request back to glance. This list is # therefore sorted, with dependent attributes as the end # 'deleted_at' depends on 'deleted' # 'checksum' depends on 'status' == 'active' 'container_format', 'status', 'id', 'deleted', 'deleted_at', 'checksum', for attr in IMAGE_ATTRIBUTES: if attr == 'deleted_at' and not output['deleted']: output[attr] = None elif attr == 'checksum' and output['status'] != 'active': output[attr] = None else: output[attr] = getattr(image, attr)

commit_message:
Adding attribute schema class for attributes

This patch introduces simple schema class for attributes.
There are two options avaliable for this schema:
 - description
 - support status
It gives ability for adding support status for each attribute.

Change-Id: I46cbf776f315cbe6414005cbee65da1cefdc5f7d
Closes-Bug: #1305584
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/25/86525/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for name, schema_data in resource_class.attributes_schema.items(): schema = attributes.Schema.from_attribute(schema_data) yield name, {schema.DESCRIPTION: schema.description}
deleted_lines: for schema_item in resource_class.attributes_schema.items(): schema = attributes.Attribute(*schema_item) yield schema.name, {schema.DESCRIPTION: schema.description}

commit_message:
Add crontab to flush tokens via keystone-manage

When the keystone tokens backend is SQL, the tokens table grows
unboundedly as new tokens are issued and not disposed of after
expiration.

Keystone provides a tool to delete the tokens, and this patch puts it in
a cronjob in order to avoid growing the tokens database forever.

Change-Id: I3e4831619efec273ac5aa378fff4b14ad877f326
Implements: blueprint token-flush
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/70/88670/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure the flush tokens cronjob run_cron = node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['enabled'] && node['openstack']['identity']['token']['backend'] == 'sql' cron_command = %Q{ echo keystone-manage token_flush running at $(/bin/date) > #{node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['log_file']} && /usr/bin/keystone-manage token_flush >> #{node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['log_file']} 2>&1 && echo keystone-manage token_flush ended with exit code $? >> #{node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['log_file']} }.gsub!(/\n/, '') # TODO(luisg): We can remove the \n substitution when https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/CHEF-5238 is fixed cron 'keystone-manage-token-flush' do minute node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['minute'] hour node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['hour'] day node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['day'] weekday node['openstack']['identity']['token_flush_cron']['weekday'] action run_cron ? :create : :delete user node['openstack']['identity']['user'] command cron_command end

commit_message:
Improve api-site handling for openstack-doc-test

Find books that need to be rebuild for api-site better:
* Handle include of wadl resources.
* Handle file layout of api-site.

Add new option --print-unused-files.

Change-Id: I8ad61cf53728e3b5ba71077bf53b1780a2535c2e

added_lines: aggregate_name = data_utils.rand_name('aggregate') az_name = data_utils.rand_name('az') resp, aggregate = cls.os_adm.aggregates_client.create_aggregate( name=aggregate_name, availability_zone=az_name) cls.aggregate_id = aggregate['id'] cls.az_name = az_name @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): cls.os_adm.aggregates_client.delete_aggregate(cls.aggregate_id) super(AZAdminTestJSON, cls).tearDownClass() def _verify_availability_zone_attributes(self, availability_zones): found = False for az in availability_zones: self.assertIn('hosts', az) self.assertIn('zoneState', az) self.assertIn('zoneName', az) if az['zoneName'] == self.az_name: found = True self.assertTrue(found) resp, availability_zones = self.client.get_availability_zone_list() self.assertTrue(len(availability_zones) > 1) self._verify_availability_zone_attributes(availability_zones) resp, availability_zones = \ self.assertTrue(len(availability_zones) > 1) self._verify_availability_zone_attributes(availability_zones)

commit_message:
Update ActiveDirectory UI to the last changes

FloatingIP doesn't do anything now (now advanced networking is
implemented yet for 0.5), so it is meaningless. Also fix references to
the Host class.

Change-Id: I3b64fb9b7d1c523e5744a561cf1e715846986cc3

added_lines: """Decodes incoming text/bytes string using `incoming` if they're not already unicode. if not isinstance(text, (six.string_types, six.binary_type)): """Encodes incoming text/bytes string using `encoding`. if not isinstance(text, (six.string_types, six.binary_type)): return text.encode(encoding, errors) return text.encode(encoding, errors) else: return text
deleted_lines: """Decodes incoming str using `incoming` if they're not already unicode. if not isinstance(text, six.string_types): """Encodes incoming str/unicode using `encoding`. if not isinstance(text, six.string_types): if six.PY3: return text.encode(encoding, errors).decode(incoming) else: return text.encode(encoding, errors) if six.PY3: return text.encode(encoding, errors).decode(incoming) else: return text.encode(encoding, errors) return text

commit_message:
Murano manifests update

* 'murano-api' is going to be renamed to 'murano'.
  Multiple renames were made because of that.
* 'murano-engine' is a part of 'murano' package.
  It was added to manifests.
* Package name is still 'murano-api', this isn't an error.

Closes-bug: #1307970

Closes-bug: #1308997

Change-Id: If6955e97b9e55cf896c0b09bdbf325f372ccc934

commit_message:
Enable serial console access to nodes

This element allows a serial connection to nodes. Can be used
for debugging purposes when a node's network is no longer working

Change-Id: I907f25f00c6547148cc2ca58cc06bb185426097b

commit_message:
Setup RabbitMQ before mcollective installation

* install RabbitMQ and create mcollective exchanges;
* restart mcollective service if config is changed;
* hearbeat for master node.

Thanks Dmitry Iliyn for helps.

Change-Id: I7b9006510d7fa747b3edf37ad724063cef122f3f
Closes-Bug: #1311530

commit_message:
Add new "role" context

For testing heat needs to have users with special role. This patch introduce
simple implementation of new role context. It gives ability to add specific
roles to all users.

Implements: blueprint roles-context

Change-Id: I1908acf5ec970acd075077e8007bd9624e2c58a9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 10:48:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/cda6f5b567411037b19ea1ecb1de1d1685bf2d52', 'message': 'Allow trollius 0.2

  patch requires Trollius 0.2, that's why I would like to upgrade Trollius

I also moved trollius to the right section of dependencies. Sorry, I didn't
noticed first that dependencies were grouped.

I also added newlines to make the file more readable, newlines are ignored.

Trollius has now a much better documentation:
http://trollius.readthedocs.org/

commit_message:
Allow trollius 0.2

As the author of Trollius, I'm asking to allow the new release because I want
to use it in pending patches.

Trollius 0.2 is compatible with 0.1.6. Trollius 0.2 has the (almost the) same
API than asyncio in Python 3.4 (will should be released next week end) and
Tulip 0.4.1. After the final release of Python 3.4, backward incompatible
changes are no more allowed, so there is no need to restrict Trollius version
to < 0.2.

Trollius 0.2 uses the syntax "yield From(...)" instead of "yield ...", but the
old syntax is still allowed.

Anyway, right now, no OpenStack component use Trollius. Pending patches:

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70948/ : patch written for Trollus 0.1, but
  it works on Trollius 0.2 too. I will update the patch to require Trollius 0.2
  and use "yield From(...)"
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/77925/ : tests are failing because this
  patch requires Trollius 0.2, that's why I would like to upgrade Trollius

I also moved trollius to the right section of dependencies. Sorry, I didn't
noticed first that dependencies were grouped.

Trollius has now a much better documentation:
http://trollius.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: I7b23262a728119350133becef18058242553a03c

commit_message:
Added developer documentation

* Updated README file
* Updated contrib/devstack/README
* Added documentation for Devstack installation
* Added documentation for manual installation of the API and Engine services
* Added basic contributing guide
* Added extended contributing guide
* Added HACKING.rst to the root of the project
* Added development guidelines
* Sets simple Sphinx theme

Partially implements blueprint: murano-dev-doc-05

Change-Id: Ib7d7b416ccc61667ed96297555db2ef5dca9ae67

commit_message:
Change 200->404 for the history of non-existent alarm

Never existent alarm history now returns 404 not found
instead of 200 ok. Tests rewritten to match the idea that
history for every created alarm contains at least record
about its creation.

Change-Id: I49128d49823b6e5a9add944c0f915798facb0b6c
Closes-Bug: #1288104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/66/89566/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: changes_gen = conn.get_alarm_changes(self._id, auth_project, **kwargs) changes = [AlarmChange.from_db_model(ac) for ac in changes_gen] # check that alarm itself was found, as if there is an alarm, it'll be # at least creation record in its history if len(changes) == 0: raise EntityNotFound(_('Alarm'), self._id) return changes
deleted_lines: return [AlarmChange.from_db_model(ac) for ac in conn.get_alarm_changes(self._id, auth_project, **kwargs)]

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-03 08:34:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/ac147d306088bf2a1ea190b1a35bbb3737876330', 'message': 'Implement testing of migrations

This patch adds opportunity of migrations testing.
By this test each migration checks on mysql/postgres dialects in
upgrade > downgrade> upgrade mode.
Also models are tested to equality with actual database state.
In this patch an opportunity of testing migrations adds.
We just need to add _pre_upgrade_NUM, _check_NUM, _post_downgrade_NUM
methods with number of migration (NUM).
It works for both of repos (migrate and alembic).

Models will be tested on different things:
- columns (type, length, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique keys, foreign keys),
- list of tables.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Implement testing of migrations

Dependences: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42307/ (should be reviewed).

This patch adds opportunity of migrations testing.
By this test each migration checks on mysql/postgres dialects in
upgrade > downgrade> upgrade mode.
Also models are tested to equality with actual database state.
In this patch an opportunity of testing migrations adds.
We just need to add _pre_upgrade_NUM, _check_NUM, _post_downgrade_NUM
methods with number of migration (NUM).
It works for both of repos (migrate and alembic).

Models will be tested on different things:
- columns (type, length, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique keys, foreign keys),
- list of tables.

This patch contains a check methods for 15 migration as a sample.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Add testing of migrations from oslo

There is a testing of migrations in oslo.
We can check equality of models with migrations in different
backends. Also we can check an each migration in full mode
(upgrade > downgrade > upgrade).
Migrate and alembic repos can be tested together.
We have only sqlite testing of migrations in upgrade mode now.
But there are a lot of bugs that can be visible in other
dialects. Also a lot of migrations that can have mistakes in downgrade.
So we should have both of these tests in ceilometer for successfull
checking of migrations.

Dependences: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42307/
             https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53612/

bp: db-common-migration-and-utils

Change-Id: I477e3593aef4119cb04f95d0dcbaef21f90e3083

subject: Detect selinux passwd setting bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 19:22:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements/commit/a54d6cf24c66855433217e0dcf452f8d870b4f3d', 'message': 'Detect bug 1292614

If on a Fedora, CentOS or RHEL system w/ SELinux enabled (even
permissive), but 1292614 will be hit. This change stops the user up
front instead of deep into the image creation.

Change-Id: I324994c239a75caf9174fe01a0aff08baa03fbf5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 20:09:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements/commit/c590f6d9b078ae66d977e12b18f50d131aae078d', 'message': 'Detect bug 1292614

If on a Fedora, CentOS or RHEL system w/ SELinux enabled (even
permissive), but 1292614 will be hit. This change stops the user up
front instead of deep into the image creation.

Change-Id: I324994c239a75caf9174fe01a0aff08baa03fbf5
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-11 20:42:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements/commit/5a85e4a2152a80acd59577d4027dc6e3c841c726', 'message': 'Detect bug 1292614

If on a Fedora, CentOS or RHEL system w/ SELinux enabled (even
permissive), but 1292614 will be hit. This change stops the user up

commit_message:
Detect selinux passwd setting bug

If on a Fedora, CentOS or RHEL system w/ SELinux enabled (even
permissive), bug 1292614 will be hit. This change stops the user
up front instead of deep into the image creation.

Change-Id: I324994c239a75caf9174fe01a0aff08baa03fbf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/03/87003/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$DEBUG_PASSWORD" -a "$platform" != 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; then if [ "$(getenforce)" != "Disabled" ]; then echo "Debug mode cannot be used from this platform while SELinux is enabled, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1292614" exit 1 fi fi

commit_message:
NetApp unified driver depends on python-suds

This patch documents the NetApp driver dependency on the python-suds
package. Users should install the python-suds package on the volume
node before enabling the driver.

Change-Id: I4546a436a2c06c1ab978705c795b512bb01a4648
Closes-Bug: 1311395
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/20/89720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <important> <para>The NetApp unified volume driver (<literal>cinder.volume.drivers.netapp.common.NetAppDriver</literal>) requires the <package>python-suds</package> package. Install this package on the volume node before enabling the unified volume driver on the node.</para> </important>

commit_message:
memcached: add locking

Change-Id: I18d5358278e31fcff1cbd1c20b7be814052cae05
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@cloudwatt.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/82/86882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tooz import lockingclass MemcachedLock(locking.Lock): _LOCK_PREFIX = b'__TOOZ_LOCK_' def __init__(self, coord, name, timeout): self.coord = coord self.name = self._LOCK_PREFIX + name self.timeout = timeout def acquire(self, blocking=True): while True: if self.coord.client.add( self.name, self.coord._member_id, expire=self.timeout, noreply=False): return True if not blocking: return False # NOTE(jd) Configurable? :/ time.sleep(0.11) def release(self): self.coord.client.delete(self.name) def __init__(self, member_id, membership_timeout=30, lock_timeout=30): self.lock_timeout = lock_timeout def get_lock(self, name): return MemcachedLock(self, name, self.lock_timeout)

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-29 01:31:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/e9243e7ef6a4925a56a0ee7e3c077f2642c33d9e', 'message': "Logical error in blockless fanout of zmq

Closes-Bug: #1293092
"}]
commit_message:
Logical error in blockless fanout of zmq

The blockless fanout doesn't take effect and it only processes
the FIRST one by returning after the first loop.

Change-Id: I8ddb80011be1965f3576331b6fd9e17f783d268f
Closes-Bug: #1293092
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/31/80831/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if method.__name__ == '_cast': for queue in queues: (_topic, ip_addr) = queue _addr = "tcp://%s:%s" % (ip_addr, conf.rpc_zmq_port) return else: for queue in queues: (_topic, ip_addr) = queue _addr = "tcp://%s:%s" % (ip_addr, conf.rpc_zmq_port) last_msg = method(_addr, context, _topic, msg, timeout, envelope) return last_msg
deleted_lines: for queue in queues: (_topic, ip_addr) = queue _addr = "tcp://%s:%s" % (ip_addr, conf.rpc_zmq_port) if method.__name__ == '_cast': return return method(_addr, context, _topic, msg, timeout, envelope)

commit_message:
Move 'Statistics' panel to the 'Deployment' dashboard

'Deployment' dashboard is renamed to 'Application Catalog', while
'Application Catalog' panel is renamed to 'Applications'.

Implements: blueprint move-statistics-panel-to-app-catalog
Partial-Bug: #1310969
Closes-Bug: #1308116
Change-Id: Id49bd00c0ed8d76407b6ddcbca9603a57dbbf9f1

commit_message:
Added function to deal with deadlock in tests

Added new method used in fake threads during test. Method catch deadlock
and retry operation in FakeDeletionThread. Removed skipping of
problematic test.

Change-Id: I47c63e4f3a86f0be24a83526f69fefda74c9b028
Closes-Bug: #1308115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/86/89786/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import refrom sqlalchemy.exc import DBAPIError _DEADLOCK_RE_DB = re.compile(r"^.*deadlock detected.*") def handling_db_errors(func, retries=0, **kwargs): try: func(**kwargs) except DBAPIError, e: # Retry only for deadlock error dbl_re = _DEADLOCK_RE_DB dbl_m = dbl_re.match(str(e)) if dbl_m and retries < 4: time.sleep(0.01) retries += 1 handling_db_errors(func, retries=retries, **kwargs) else: raise DBAPIError(e) handling_db_errors(resp_method, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Break Identity API into v2 and v3 pages

Add authenticate call to first page of api ref
Fix titles to match correct API versions
Added forward slash to beginning of all API calls
Added neutron to occurrences of OpenStack Networking
Other clean up

Change-Id: Ifcb51efa5996d083d9e6099c9b72b8faf39707b2
author: diane fleming

commit_message:
Make Search query ignore current category

Search should be run against all possible categories, otherwise it is
much less useful. So, after user submits Search request,
current_category will be set to 'All'. Also page navigation for
multi-paged search results is fixed (it didn't work earlier).

Change-Id: I556fa7cc23f4c004047c36d8aa11097a21a2d477
Closes-Bug: #1307931

added_lines: else: if category != ALL_CATEGORY_NAME: query_params['category'] = category

commit_message:
[IT] More coverage of EDP in tests

The check for bug #1302579 (Sahara with mysql don't support upload job binary
over 64kB) is added.

The check is added for Vanilla2 plugin because there is the only file that has
size more than 64 kb. This file is "hadoop-mapreduce-examples-2.3.0.jar".

Change-Id: Ic4b6f3a712dea998a0dcfa37ce044be43dcb8188
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/07/89607/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import filecmp # check that files more than 64 kb are downloaded into data base # completely (it is required for MySQL data base). # "hadoop-mapreduce-examples-2.3.0.jar" file has 270 kb size job_binary_internal_id = self.sahara.job_binary_internals.create( name='job-binary-internal-size-test', data=java_jar).id job_binary_id = self.sahara.job_binaries.create( name='job-binary-size-test', url='internal-db://%s' % job_binary_internal_id, extra={}, description='').id downloaded_java_jar = self.sahara.job_binaries.get_file( job_binary_id) if downloaded_java_jar != java_jar: raise AssertionError( '"hadoop-mapreduce-examples-2.3.0.jar" file (size 270 kb) was ' 'not completely uploaded into data base!') # run EDP job

commit_message:
Allow settings for Nova Scheduler

This change is to allow settings for nova scheduler:

scheduler_available_filters
  Filter classes available to the scheduler which may be specified more
  than once.

scheduler_default_filters
  Which filter class names to use for filtering hosts when not specified
  in the request.

scheduler_weight_classes
  Which weight class names to use for weighing hosts.

scheduler_driver
  Default driver to use for the scheduler.

scheduler_host_subset_size
  New instances will be scheduled on a host chosen randomly from a subset of
  the N best hosts. This property defines the  subset size that a host is
  chosen from.

Change-Id: Ia622ad4d64b298f0a8dc3cb0b9ba1561862b7f23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/31/84131/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: scheduler: scheduler_available_filters: Filter classes available to the scheduler which may be specified more than once. scheduler_default_filters: Which filter class names to use for filtering hosts when not specified in the request. scheduler_weight_classes: Which weight class names to use for weighing hosts. scheduler_driver: Default driver to use for the scheduler. scheduler_host_subset_size: New instances will be scheduled on a host chosen randomly from a subset of the N best hosts. This property defines the subset size that a host is chosen from. ram_weight_multiplier: Multiplier used for weighing ram.

subject: Allow settings for Nova API
revisions:

Allow settings for:

osapi_compute_workers
  - Number of workers for OpenStack API service. The default will be the
    number of CPUs available. (integer value)

osapi_compute_extension
  - osapi compute extension to load.

osapi_compute_ext_list
  - Specify list of extensions to load when using
    osapi_compute_extension option with
    nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.select_extensions.

multi_instance_display_name_template
  - Template used to build the display name for instances created using a
    single request via os-multiple-create API extension.

commit_message:
Allow settings for Nova API

Allow settings for:

osapi_compute_workers
  - Number of workers for OpenStack API service. The default will be the
    number of CPUs available. (integer value)

osapi_compute_extension
  - osapi compute extension to load.

osapi_compute_ext_list
  - Specify list of extensions to load when using
    osapi_compute_extension option with
    nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.select_extensions.

multi_instance_display_name_template
  - Template used to build the display name for instances created using a
    single request via os-multiple-create API extension.

Change-Id: I47460fa7fbbf40aa72c7ebafd9e5c00ebf0c6b7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/94/83794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: osapi_compute_workers: - Number of workers for OpenStack API service. The default will be the number of CPUs available. commit_message:
Allow settings for metadata workers

This change is to allow the setting for the number of metadata workers, the
default value in None but it's quite common to tune this parameter:
metadata_workers:
  - number of workers for metadata service.

Change-Id: I92908887e59b2f81d5f21cd5e1efc8424d008e1b

commit_message:
Adding libvirt options for injection and rescue

This change is adding some specific options to configure the file injection and
the rescue image ids to be used for rescuing an instance:
inject_partition
  - The partition to inject to: -2 => disable, -1 => inspect
    (libguestfs only), 0 => not partitioned, >0 => partition
rescue_image_id
  - Rescue ami image
rescue_kernel_id
  - Rescue aki image
rescue_ramdisk_id
  - Rescue ari image

Change-Id: I338a67b695bb4cf160ef5e2f326e60fa900a4fd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/39/85339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make time out 60 mins like the Heat default.

Make the undercloud create timeout match that of the Heat default
(60 mins for the Heat stack-create), as on slow networks with real
hardware the set-up time can be slow. Also if the stack-create
fails the loop will exit so this change should be harmless.

Change-Id: Iec8aafb73f0b9da72ae9a94d9a4e7c91bd29e496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/18/87118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make time out 60 mins as like the Heat stack-create default timeout. wait_for_stack_ready 240 15 undercloud

commit_message:
run_tests.sh improvements

1. Run shotgun's tests

2. Write XUnit data to separate files

   Since now, the `run_tests.sh` writes XUnit XMLs as separate files.
   Both filenames and paths could be overridden by setuping next env variables:

   * NAILGUN_XUNIT                  (default: nailgun.xml)
   * FUELCLIENT_XUNIT               (default: fuelclient.xml)
   * FUELUPGRADE_XUNIT              (default: fuelupgrade.xml)
   * FUELUPGRADEDOWNLOADER_XUNIT    (default: fuelupgradedownloader.xml)
   * SHOTGUN_XUNIT                  (default: shotgun.xml)

   Example:

       NAILGUN_XUNIT="~/reports/nailgun.xml" ./run_tests.sh --with-xunit

Closes-Bug: #1304361
Closes-Bug: #1311073

Change-Id: I60e7733ed4c85e6decb29635d55e3ec8befa8ee1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/50/87550/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # nosetest xunit options NAILGUN_XUNIT=${NAILGUN_XUNIT:-'nailgun.xml'} FUELCLIENT_XUNIT=${FUELCLIENT_XUNIT:-'fuelclient.xml'} $TESTRTESTS -vv $testropts $TESTS --xunit-file $NAILGUN_XUNIT ${TESTRTESTS} -vv $testropts $TESTS --xunit-file $FUELCLIENT_XUNIT

commit_message:
begin conversion to rst

This converts 2 of the reference documents to rst, and fixes the
tox.ini so that tox -e docs creates a pretty html version of these
documents. While the publish target location has still not been
sorted this moves the ball forward in generating nicer output
for the documents.

The incubation-integration-requirements document was intentionally
left out, because it's much more active, and we should decide this
is the right approach before we impose the merge conflicts on
everyone in flight.

Change-Id: I2fefdb5efe196cdbda4555141b09e7e771e20bdd

commit_message:
Use "https" instead of "git" for cloning code

If you're in a private network, you need to setup a proxy
to access the public network. It would be a difficult thing
to set-up proxy for git:// protocol, while much more easy to
use https:// protocol instead.

Change-Id: Iec8447cc28760a98e1641162c50c152c89100775

commit_message:
Explicitly open tftpd port in iptables on Fedora

Seems like on Fedora default firewall settings prevent instance
from accessing port 69. This patch explicitly opens this port in iptables.

Change-Id: Ic0f841165d5c71d6fe6663855522145d75b55092

commit_message:
Fixes neutron empty fields problem

Fixes the errors that appear when no dns or host_routes
are given.
Also fixes an error when theres already an existing subnet
while trying to create again (eg. re running the same manifest
again)

Change-Id: Ib2a88f0fc39f2fe44ed6dcfa77891ceaabaf612e
Fixes: rhbz#1086150

subject: Fix tempest_*_id_setter to query the RAL and cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 00:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/tempest_neutron_net_id_setter/ruby.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/tempest_glance_id_setter/ruby.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest/commit/5ef9dc94b4a395b6f60997aeed55f210acb25223', 'message': "Fix tempest_*_id_setter to query the RAL and cache

The tempest_glance_id_setter previously would query the catalog for the
id of a glance_image resource with a given name. This doesn't work on a
split-node openstack where tempest is not on the glance host. It would
also fail horribly if glance-api.conf didn't exist.

The tempest_neutron_id_setter previously would query the instances of
neutron network IDs from the RAL once for every line in the tempest.conf
file if the network did not exist (because the cache would be nil).

Now they both query the RAL directly from the system, similar to how
tempest_neutron_id_setter did it but using Puppet::Resource.indirection,
but don't continue requerying for every line in the tempest.conf when
the given resource title doesn't yet exist, and tempest_glance_id_setter
raises a helpful error if the glance-api.conf file does not exist.

Change-Id: Icdca2c1a5f449b3fcda68d43a34452cd119303cb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest_*_id_setter to query the RAL and cache

The tempest_glance_id_setter previously would query the catalog for the
id of a glance_image resource with a given name. This doesn't work on a
split-node openstack where tempest is not on the glance host. It would
also fail horribly if glance-api.conf didn't exist.

The tempest_neutron_id_setter previously would query the instances of
neutron network IDs from the RAL once for every line in the tempest.conf
file if the network did not exist (because the cache would be nil).

Now they both query the RAL directly from the system, similar to how
tempest_neutron_id_setter did it but using Puppet::Resource.indirection,
but don't continue requerying for every line in the tempest.conf when
the given resource title doesn't yet exist, and tempest_glance_id_setter
raises a helpful error if the glance-api.conf file does not exist.

Change-Id: Icdca2c1a5f449b3fcda68d43a34452cd119303cb

commit_message:
Update quota when instance stuck to DELETING

The only place we ever update quotas as part of delete should
be when the instance DB record is removed. If something is
stuck in DELETING, it means that the quota was not updated.
We should make sure we're always updating the quota when
the instance DB record is removed.

Change-Id: I7debe92fb815393830cf59dc309c6a0af9d0152e
Partial-Bug: #1296414

commit_message:
Include extra attributes in list results

The extra attributes defined in the *_additional_attribute_mapping config
options weren't included in the list results. These attributes should be
included in the list results.

Change-Id: Ia80174063a5eacdef690ca378b7cb71300a5f5f8
Closes-Bug: #1293698

commit_message:
dry_run can be optional

node_remove.rb is not sending this parameter, so if it is not optional,
there would be error like:

MC agent 'erase_node', method 'erase_node', results:
{
    :sender=>"2", :statuscode=>4,
    :statusmsg=>"Action 'erase_node' needs a 'dry_run' argument",
    :data=>
    {
        :status=>nil, :erased=>nil, :error_msg=>nil, :debug_msg=>nil,
        :rebooted=>nil
    }
}

Change-Id: I2d6115c2a7c1ed765e34b03bc1907c2fd5204002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/08/79808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :optional => true

commit_message:
Make heat default infrastructure engine

We're running heat-based savanna-ci jobs for a while and heat
integration seems mostly completed. So, let's enable it by default and
then direct (savanna) infrastructure engine will be ready for removal in
Juno release cycle.

Change-Id: I9dfc017c3f6dba4e2542f9fb01d9ad9c46b70300

commit_message:
Allow setting the location of VM swapfile for libvirtDriver

Add support to set the location of virtual machine swap files separately
for libvirtDriver. With such a feature enabled, swapfiles can be placed onto
a specified storage, e.g. a SSD, separately, that improve the performance
of guest VM.

Related to blueprint set-vm-swapfile-location.

Change-Id: Icc917a26a0ac797d8496ead320144bb8078462fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/27/83727/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================================= add configuration item to set virtual machine swap file location ================================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/set-vm-swapfile-location add support to set the location of virtual machine swap files seperatedly. with such a feature enabled, swapfiles can be placed onto a specidied storage, e.g. a SSD,seperatedly, that improve the performace of guest vm . Problem description ==================== Currently, disk.swap(the swap file of instance) is created in the <instances_path>(default is /var/lib/nova/instances/<vm-uuid>), the base file is in /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/swap_XXX. We cannot place the swap files onto a specified storage,e.g. a SSD, seperatedly. proposed change ================ 1.add configuration item <swap_files_path> in nova.conf to set the location of virtual machine swap file , such as: swap_files_path=/var/lib/nova/swapfiles/ 2.place the swap file (such as <vm-uuid>.swap)and its base file (such as swap_XXX) onto swap_files_path. 3.create soft link such as: disk.swap -> <swap_files_path>/<vm-uuid>.swap swap_XXX -> <swap_files_path>/swap_XXX Alternatives ------------- None Data model impact ------------------ None REST API impact ---------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications impact --------------------- None Other End user impact ----------------------- None Performance Impact --------------------- 1.If the swap files are placed on s local SSD, I think it will improve the performance of guest vm in some cases. 2.There is no impact about the performance of nova. Deployer impact ---------------- If there is local SSDs in computer node, suggest to config <swap_files_path>. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- assignee:Zhou Yu <vitas.yuzhou@huawei.com> Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will check if nova create swapfiles onto <swap_files_path>, the code changes about this bp are litte, I think unit tests are sufficient. Documentation Impact ==================== add a suggestion in configuration doc ,such as: If there are local SSDs in computer node, suggest to config <swap_files_path>. References ========== None

commit_message:
Record the attached volume read and write metering sample

If attach a volume to a instance, then record the every volume
read and write metering data.My implement like collect the disk
data, just need to get the volume full information form the cinder
client.

Implements: blueprint record-attached-volume-io-sample

Change-Id: Ieb628f6714de9c4fbdee5c906cb5c37ee1d2cf74

commit_message:
Don't slugify() None names

If image has no name, human_id can't be built.
Also slugify raises ValueError if None argument passed.
It affects Docker images.

This is a copy of Change Ib975775b here:

https://review.openstack.org/65665

The original change was made against python-novaclient and then
subsequently overwritten when resynced with oslo-incubator.  This
reapplies the change, except within oslo-incubator this time.

Change-Id: If9f1b42bc028b314ff030ef063bffee656507625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/48/76248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = getattr(self, self.NAME_ATTR) if name is not None: return strutils.to_slug(name)

commit_message:
Add initial support for FreeBSD host as a compute node

The purpose of this blueprint is introducing support for FreeBSD host as
a nova compute node.

Change-Id: I80804f0db3f9dde7f097411b6537515b7aa40897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/19/85119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Add initial support for FreeBSD host as a compute node ====================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/freebsd-compute-node The purpose of this work is to provide support for compute nodes running on the FreeBSD operating system. Those will be able to run VMs with either qemu or the native FreeBSD hypervisor - bhyve. Also it will include a minimal nova-network driver supporting the bridge mode networks. Problem description =================== Right now deployers are not able to build their cloud using FreeBSD as a host for compute node servers. There is no support for that OS in nova. Consequently, recently grown FreeBSD native hypervisor - bhyve can not be utilized. Proposed change =============== Extend existing libvirt compute driver so that it supports both qemu and bhyve managed VMs on FreeBSD platforms, along with other necessary adjustments for the nova.virt subsystem and simple bridge mode networking. Alternatives ------------ An alternative approach would be to implement separate, native bhyve compute driver for nova. Still, necessity for the freebsd_net driver for nova-network would apply here. This path seems to be more complicated and harder to accomplish. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <md-sh> Work Items ---------- * Adjustments to the libvirt compute driver to support new hypervisor backend - bhyve. * Adjustments to the libvirt vif driver to support other than linux_net nova-network driver. * Implementation of libvirt firewall driver as iptables are not available on FreeBSD * Implementation of freebsd_net driver (equivalent of linux_net) for nova-network to support guest networking. * Implementation of FreeBSD memory disk support (equivalent of loop device on Linux) for nova.virt.disk.mount module, necessary for file injection into guest's file systems. * Adjustments to nova.virt.configdrive module to support FreeBSD platform. Dependencies ============ Primary new dependency is the FreeBSD OS itself. There might be new command line tools dependency like 'mdconfig' ('losetup' on Linux), etc. Testing ======= New CI for FreeBSD platform has to be introduced, where all unit and integration tests will be run. Documentation Impact ==================== * There has to be new installation guide for FreeBSD. * Configuration options reference should be updated with new value options. References ========== * http://www.freebsd.org/ * http://bhyve.org/ * http://libvirt.org/

commit_message:
Add python-keystoneclient to requirements.txt

Although not required for all uses of swift using keystone auth is
common enough that it isn't a special case and should be a dependency.

Closes-Bug: #1085740

commit_message:
Compatibility with Pep8 1.5.4+

Pep8 1.5.4+ fixes various bugs in space/indentation detection,
so accommodate for those:

  E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
  E123 closing bracket does not match indentation of opening bracket's
  line
  E251 unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals
  E714 test for object identity should be 'is not'
  E713 test for membership should be 'not in'
  E265 block comment should start with '# '

Change-Id: I5b1daac701dd53a0f639583a61404429dd2161fe

commit_message:
escape and encode HTTP headers

The v1 glanceclient takes various user input for image metadata and
encodes it as HTTP headers.  Some level of armoring against
malice/incompetence should be done here.  e.g., the
"x-image-meta-property-description" header is a free-form text
field, and can have newlines, but passing in newlines breaks
everything, and leaves the API prone to injection attacks.

Change-Id: I3f0fbda47f5392b00d152d58ef1d94ce034eadf5
Partial-Bug: 1297414

commit_message:
Change volume retype behavior when driver raise exception

When modifying volume type, if driver returns False stand for
the driver not support it, then the operation will fall back
to generic mechanism.

But if driver raises exception, should report error and set
volume status as "error".

Change-Id: Icc9421a331b094049242c4115d9f08b318a6f99c
Closes-Bug: #1305550

commit_message:
OFAgent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

Port the following patch to OFAgent.
commit: 5e6e592132aa9a98936ce3bfdb66efc7832caafb
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61964/

Partial-Bug: 1293265

Change-Id: I53813d12c66dc746cd373fd91ff9bd9bdbf222db
